title: â€˜Why Would Any Christian Vote For Her?â€™: Pro-Life Orgs React To Harrisâ€™ â€˜Anti-Religious Freedomâ€™ Abortion Stance
content:
Pro-life organizations are speaking out against Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris after she stated she did not believe in religious exemptions for abortion.
Vice President Harris made the statement in an interview with NBC News Tuesday evening when asked directly if she would agree to any concessions on abortion such as religious exemptions. Christian and pro-life organizations are rallying against the candidate in response to her â€œpro-abortionâ€ and â€œanti-religious freedomâ€ stance.
â€œI donâ€™t think we should be making concessions when weâ€™re talking about a fundamental freedom to make decisions about your own body,â€ Harris said to Hallie Jackson Tuesday.
Wow.
Kamala Harris says that she does not believe in any religious exemptions for abortion.pic.twitter.com/oOiJJOi6Ib
â€” Greg Price (@greg_price11) October 22, 2024
â€œKamala Harris admits she would deny religious exemptions for abortions â€” forcing Christians to kill unborn children and seemingly doubling down on weaponizing the government to jail pro-lifers who pray outside abortion facilities,â€ CatholicVote said in an X post Tuesday. â€œWhy would any Christian vote for her?â€
Kamala Harris admits she would deny religious exemptions for abortionsâ€”forcing Christians to kill unborn children and seemingly doubling down on weaponizing the government to jail pro-lifers who pray outside abortion facilities.
Why would any Christian vote for her? pic.twitter.com/QwoDLxUb0D
â€” CatholicVote (@CatholicVote) October 22, 2024
Harris has been accused by pro-life Christians of weaponizing the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances (FACE) Act by using the Department of Justice (DOJ) to jail pro-lifers for praying outside of abortion clinics.
â€œKamala Harris promises â€˜freedomâ€™ but then pledges to federally steamroll Americans into taking part in abortions against their will,â€ Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America posted to X. â€œDocs must perform them, taxpayers must pay for them, for any reason, in all 50 states, no exceptions.â€
.@KamalaHarris promises â€˜freedomâ€™ but then pledges to federally steamroll Americans into taking part in abortions against their will.
Docs must perform them, taxpayers must pay for them, for any reason, in all 50 states, no exceptions. pic.twitter.com/DHRHTd14xo
â€” SBA Pro-Life America (@sbaprolife) October 22, 2024
Harris has frequently dodged the question of whether she would support any limits on abortion, telling CBS News in a 2023 â€œFace the Nationâ€ interview that â€œthe women of America should be trusted to make decisions about their life and their body based on what they know to be in their best interest. Itâ€™s that simple.â€ (RELATED: Tim Walz Turned His State Into A Destination For Late-Term Abortions)
â€œSo sheâ€™s not only pro-abortion, she is anti-religious freedom,â€ Ralph Reed, chairman of the Faith and Freedom Coalition, said on X. â€œDuly noted.â€
So sheâ€™s not only pro-abortion, she is anti-religious freedom. Duly noted. https://t.co/vd1wv4gvIm
â€” Ralph Reed (@ralphreed) October 22, 2024
Harris plans to highlight the abortion issue during a campaign stop in Texas Friday, according to Politico.
CatholicVote has previously sounded the alarm on Harrisâ€™ radical abortion stance, warning Catholics that her blatantly â€œanti-Catholicâ€ agenda presents â€œclear and present dangerâ€ to Christians.
The Harris campaign did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: MSNBC Guest Claims Kamala Harris Running â€˜One Of The Most Perfectly Executed Campaignsâ€™ In American History
content:
Former Republican strategist Stuart Stevens claimed Wednesday that Vice President Kamala Harris is running an outstanding campaign against former President Donald Trump.
Trump trails Harris by 0.6% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 8 â€“ 22, with the gap increasing to 0.8% when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys. Stevens cited the campaignâ€™s use of Hollywood actors like â€œWest Wingâ€ star Bradley Whitford and â€œGood Wifeâ€ star Christine Baranski. (RELATED: NY Times Poll Shows Harrisâ€™ Support Among Key Voter Bloc In â€˜Dangerously Low Territoryâ€™)
WATCH:
â€œItâ€™s huge because thereâ€™s a special connection there. You know, when you see these performers and they come to their hometowns or they come to some place, you know, like where they grew up, they can bond on that,â€ Stevens said. â€œWhat itâ€™s really saying is, you know, you and I are not that different. Iâ€™m famous, but we share the same values. Letâ€™s work together on this. I think itâ€™s really smart.â€
â€œAnd I have to say, I think when this thing is over and done with and Harris has won, which I think sheâ€™s going to do rather comfortably, I think weâ€™re going to look back on this as one of the most perfectly executed campaigns in modern history,â€ Stevens continued.
Trump leads Harris by 0.6% in polls of Pennsylvania voters from Sept. 28 to Oct. 19, according to the RealClearPolling average. Harris leads Trump by 0.3% when Stein, West and Oliver are included as options in the surveys.
Trump also leads Harris by 0.6% in polls of Michigan voters from Sept. 21 to Oct. 9, according to the RealClearPolling average. Harris has a lead of 0.5% when West, Stein and Oliver are included as options in the surveys. (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œCleaning Up Kamalaâ€)
In head-to-head matchups, Trump also holds slight leads in Wisconsin, Arizona, Georgia and North Carolina, according to RealClearPolling.

title: Nearly 1 Million Illegal Migrants Benefiting From â€˜Quiet Amnestyâ€™ Under Biden Admin, House Report Reveals
content:
Nearly 1 million illegal migrants in the United States have benefited from â€œquiet amnestyâ€ by the Biden-Harris immigration court system, according to a report released Thursday.
Over 700,000 illegal migrants have had their cases administratively closed, terminated or dismissed, allowing them to remain in the country â€œindefinitelyâ€ without being subject to immigration consequences, according to a report released by the House Judiciary Committee, led by Ohio GOP Rep. Jim Jordan. The findings, which the committee dubbed as â€œquiet amnesty,â€ come amid record levels of illegal immigration into the country under the current administration.(RELATED: Migration Crisis Fueled Rise In Tuberculosis Cases, Study Finds)
â€œFor almost four years, Americans have watched as President Joe Biden and border czar Vice President Kamala Harris have abandoned the southwest border and welcomed nearly 8 million illegal aliens into the United States,â€ the report stated.
â€œThrough administrative maneuvering at both the Justice Department and [the Department of Homeland Security], the Biden-Harris Administration has already ensured that nearly 1 million illegal aliens can remain in the United States without the possibility of deportationâ€”and that trend shows no sign of stopping,â€ the report went on.
When a non-citizen enters the U.S. unlawfully, they can be placed into removal proceedings and eventually go before one of the roughly 700 immigration judges across the country.
Due to the unprecedented border crisis and wave of foreign nationals applying for asylum, the immigration court system has faced a massive backlog, the report detailed. The backlog grew from 1.2 million cases at the end of the Trump administration to nearly 3.5 million cases by the end of the third quarter of fiscal year 2024 â€” marking a 175% increase.
The Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR) additionally reported nearly 109,100 cases as â€œnot adjudicatedâ€ in fiscal year 2023, meaning that the cases were completed but not adjudicated on the merits of the claims, according to the House report. There were 109,568 asylum cases not adjudicated in just the first nine months of fiscal year 2024, already surpassing the total previous fiscal year. (RELATED: â€˜I Love Kamalaâ€™: Migrants Fear Trump Victory As Caravan Heads To US)
For comparison, there were just 12,960 total asylum cases reported as â€œnot adjudicatedâ€ from fiscal years 2017 to 2020 â€” combined, according to the House report.
The Biden-Harris administration additionally failed to file the required documentation to begin immigration court removal proceedings for around 200,00 cases, resulting in the â€œoverwhelming majorityâ€ of those non-citizens being able to remain in the country indefinitely, the report found.
â€œInstead of actually adjudicating illegal aliensâ€™ cases based on the merits of aliensâ€™ claims for relief â€” such as whether an alien has a valid and successful asylum claim â€” immigration judges under the Biden-Harris Administration have been tasked with rubberstamping case dismissals, case closures, and case terminations, all of which allow illegal aliens to remain in the United States without immigration consequences,â€ the report stated.
â€œThis sort of quiet amnesty has become a staple of the Biden-Harris Administrationâ€™s immigration courts,â€ the report continued.
The Department of Justice, which oversees EOIR, declined to comment for this story.

title: â€˜Youâ€™re Not A Kamala Person, I Know Youâ€™: Trump Makes His Case To Joe Rogan On Why Heâ€™s A Better Candidate Than Harris
content:
Former President Donald Trump made his case to major podcaster Joe Rogan and his listeners why he is the superior 2024 presidential nominee Friday in a highly-anticipated episode of â€œThe Joe Rogan Experience.â€
As the two filmed their three-hour unscripted discussion in Austin, Trump spoke about launching the U.S. Space Force during his first term before he highlighted billionaire Elon Muskâ€™s SpaceX and Starlink endeavors. Trump noted Musk proudly endorsed him and urged Rogan â€” who he said is â€œnot a Kamala personâ€ â€” to do the same.
â€œHe gave me the nicest endorsement too. Tough. He said, â€˜The countryâ€™s gonna fail.â€™ You should do the same thing, Joe, because you cannot be voting for Kamala,â€ Trump said as Rogan broke out into laughter.
â€œKamala! Youâ€™re not a Kamala person,â€ he told Rogan. â€œI know you. Iâ€™ve watched you! I know him better than he â€” you know what? Without speaking to you, I think I know you maybe almost as well as your wife.â€
ğŸ”¥ WATCH: Donald Trump says directly to Joe Rogan he should NOT vote for Kamala.
â€œYou cannot be voting for Kamala. Youâ€™re not a Kamala person. Iâ€™ve watched you [â€¦] I have watched you for so many years. Youâ€™re not a Kamala person.â€

Trump claimed to Rogan he watched the podcaster for years before expounding on Muskâ€™s Starlink, his own economic leadership and the tax cuts during his first term as president.
The GOP nominee was then pressed on Harrisâ€™s comparing him to Adolf Hitler, prompting Trump to blast his opponent and the Democratic Party for their escalatory rhetoric. He also suggested Harris should take a cognitive test. (RELATED: â€˜You Said A Lot Of Wild Sh*tâ€™: Joe Rogan Explains Trumpâ€™s Unique Path To The Presidency)
â€œShe has a very low IQ,â€ Trump told Rogan. â€œI think Kamala should have a test because thereâ€™s something missing. Thereâ€™s something wrong.â€
JUST IN: Donald Trump rips Kamala Harris for calling him â€œH*tler,â€ responds by saying that she has a very low IQ.
Trump called for Harris to take an IQ test during his interview with Joe Rogan.
â€œYou know, Kamala is a very low IQ person. She has a very low IQ. Iâ€™m for takingâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/lGu9RR8eVr

Rogan emphasized the importance of timing when it came to booking an interview with Trump, identifying the moment the GOP nominee was nearly assassinated on July 13 at a Butler, Pennsylvania rally as when he knew he had to do it.
. @joerogan tells @realDonaldTrump that he knew he had to have him on the podcast when he was shot in Butler PA.
Then they talk about his bullet scar. Trump: â€œIt makes me a tougher guy.â€ pic.twitter.com/swlMZiSJ2f

â€œOnce they shot you, I was like, â€˜Heâ€™s got to come in here. Itâ€™s all about timing,â€ Rogan remarked, sitting across from Trump 11 days before Election Day.
â€œThe timing is good,â€ Trump responded.
â€œThe timing is perfect,â€ the podcaster added.
Trump said Harris would be â€œlaying on the floor comatoseâ€ if she did Roganâ€™s show, but the podcaster suggested the vice president may appear before Election Day.
â€œCould you imagine Kamala doing this show?â€ Trump asked.
â€œI could imagine her doing this show,â€ Rogan interjected, telling Trump he will continue to try to book Harris and would talk to her like a â€œhuman being.â€
Trump: Can you imagine Kamala doing this show?
Rogan: I could imagine her doing this show.
Trump: Sheâ€™d be laying on the floor.
Rogan: She was supposed to do it. And she might still do it. I hope she does.
Trump: Sheâ€™s not gonna do it.
Rogan: I will talk to her like aâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/KNv2bjDPmz

Harris backed out of an interview with Rogan on Thursday due to a scheduling conflict, Harris campaign spokesperson Ian Sams told MSNBC anchor Chris Hayes.
The Democratic nominee visited Texas on Friday, the same day as Trump. Harris held a rally with pop icon BeyoncÃ© â€” who had previously been rumored to be appearing at the 2024 Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Chicago.
Following the interview with Rogan which garnered 11 million YouTube views in 13 hours, Trump spoke at a Friday night rally in Michigan. He blasted Harris for putting on a star-studded show at the same time Israel was launching a strike on Iran in retaliation for its Oct. 1 missile attack.
You liars doctored the clip. Hereâ€™s what he said:

â€” Trump War Room (@TrumpWarRoom) October 26, 2024
â€œThe Middle East is like a tinderbox: itâ€™s ready to explode, people being killed at levels that weâ€™ve never seen before. And thatâ€™s taking place right now,â€ Trump said.
â€œNobody is in charge; Joe Biden is asleep. Kamala is at a dance party with BeyoncÃ©,â€ the Republican nominee stated as rally-goers erupted with boos.

title: CNN Panelist Says Biden Should â€˜Embraceâ€™ Calling Trump Supporters â€˜Garbageâ€™
content:
CNN senior political analyst Mark Preston said Wednesday President Joe Biden should own up to calling former President Donald Trumpâ€™s supporters â€œgarbage.â€
Biden made the comments Tuesday during a virtual campaign event in response to a joke stand-up comedian Tony Hinchcliffe told during Trumpâ€™s Sunday rally at Madison Square Garden. Preston said that doubling down on the comments would make Democrats look â€œstrong.â€ (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Helpful If Youâ€™ll Answer The Questionâ€™: Harris Faulkner Chides Dem Guest For Spinning When Asked About Kamala Harris Comparing Trump To Hitler)
WATCH:
â€œIâ€™m of the mindset that if you say it, you might as well just embrace it, and I do think that thatâ€™s a problem for Democrats,â€ Preston said as â€œCNN This Morningâ€ host Kasie Hunt was seeking comments from political strategists on the panel.
â€œItâ€™s shocking, you know, that I would say that. No, but realistically, like I do think if he said, listen, yeah, I do mean all those racist supporters of Donald Trump, yeah, I do think that theyâ€™re terrible. I think that people would look at the Democratic Party a little bit different,â€ Preston added. â€œI do think that the Democratic Party in general doesnâ€™t look like they are strong enough and they will always back off of things. And I think that when Joe Biden backs off of saying what he really believes, I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s a good look.â€
Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Democratic Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, have escalated attacks on Trump, with Harris devoting a major speech Tuesday to attacking the former president as a â€œpetty tyrantâ€ days after calling Trump a â€œfascistâ€ during a CNN town hall. Walz compared Trumpâ€™s rally at Madison Square Garden to a 1939 rally at the venue held by a group sympathetic to Nazi Germany.
The Harris campaign has actively distanced itself from Biden on the campaign trail.
Harris trails Trump by 0.4% in the RealClear Polling average of polls from Oct. 11 to 29, with Trumpâ€™s lead dropping to 0.1% when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Tim Walz Welcomed Chinese Communist Party Officials Into His Nebraska Classroom
content:
Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, the Democratic vice presidential nominee, welcomed Chinese Communist Party (CCP) officials into his Nebraska classroom while working as a teacher in the 1990s, a Daily Caller News Foundation investigation found.
In February 1996, a delegation of three â€œeducatorsâ€ from southeast China visited Walzâ€™s Alliance High School social studies class â€œto study the education system,â€ according to an unearthed Alliance Times-Herald article. However, the delegation included CCP officials who at the time worked for an institute serving a Chinese influence and intelligence agency, according to a DCNF review of Chinese government records.
Walzâ€™s longstanding relationship with China has come under increased scrutiny following Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ August selection of the two-term governor as her running mate. Media reports have since revealed Walz not only misrepresented key details about his China travels, but also appointed a member of a political faction loyal to the CCP to Minnesotaâ€™s executive branch.
Neither Walzâ€™s office nor the Harris-Walz campaign responded to multiple requests for comment. (RELATED: Tim Walz Appointed Member Of Political Party â€˜Loyalâ€™ To Chinese Communists To State Board)
Republican lawmakers have been demanding answers from federal authorities about the governorâ€™s ties to the communist nation.
Kentucky Rep. James Comer, House Committee on Oversight and Accountability chairman, sent a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray in August requesting information on â€œany Chinese entity or individual with whom Mr. Walz may have engaged or partnered.â€
â€œGovernor Tim Walzâ€™s documented relationships with Chinese Communist Party affiliated entities and officials bears hallmarks of a CCP infiltration and influence campaign,â€ Comer told the DCNF.
â€œFBI briefers recently informed the Oversight Committee that the Bureauâ€™s Foreign Influence Task Force investigates CCP subnational influence operations and activity that is similar to how China has engaged with Governor Walz,â€ Comer said. â€œThe American people deserve to fully understand how deep Governor Walzâ€™s relationship with the CCP goes and the Oversight Committee will continue to press for answers.â€
â€˜Engagement With The CCPâ€™
During a weeks-long tour of U.S. schools, the three members of the Chinese delegation stopped at the rural Nebraska high school where Walz taught social studies, and where he and his wife had been running a program taking students to China.
â€œFour years ago we had some Alliance High students in China. Weâ€™ve had some each year (since),â€ the designated interpreter, Ning Ziheng, stated during the 1996 visit, Alliance Times-Herald reported.
Identified as being affiliated with Macao Political Institute, Ning Ziheng served as interpreter for Ye Guoqiang and Yi Hongtao, both of whom were members of the Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education, according to the local paper. Located in Guangdong province, the Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education is the â€œonly sports university of higher education in South China,â€ its archived website states.
While the DCNF found no evidence that Ning Ziheng is a CCP member, the other two had been members of Chinaâ€™s ruling party for decades, according to a DCNF review of Chinese government and academic records.
An archived version of Yi Hongtaoâ€™s profile on the Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education website states he joined the CCP in 1976. At the time of the 1996 visit, Yi Hongtao served as the director of the Foreign Affairs Office at Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education and later as a member of the instituteâ€™s CCP committee, according to Chinese government records.
A 2021 social media post from the Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education announced that the other delegation member, Ye Guoqiang, had been a CCP member for 56 years â€” indicating he joined decades before the 1996 Nebraska visit.
Chinese government reports from Guangdong province state Ye Guoqiang served as deputy party secretary in Guangzhou Institute of Physical Educationâ€™s CCP committee. Between 1992 and 1997, the instituteâ€™s CCP committee published reports authored by Ye Guoqiang, indicating he served as deputy party secretary at the time of the 1996 Nebraska visit.
â€œOur main purpose is to learn something about education in the states,â€ said Ning Ziheng of the 1996 trip, according to Alliance Times-Herald. â€œWe will compare it to China and see how we can improve our own education system.â€
Alliance High Schoolâ€™s superintendent, Bill Gannon, invited the Chinese delegation to visit the school, Alliance Times-Herald reported. Gannon could not be reached for comment.
â€œThe current school board and administration did not work with Mr. Walz,â€ Troy Unzicker, superintendent of Alliance Public Schools, told the DCNF by email. â€œI personally do not know Mr. Walz, so I would be of no help. I am not aware of anyone in the school system that was involved with this.â€
During their two days in Alliance, the delegation reportedly first stopped by the Central Elementary School English class of Walzâ€™s wife, Gwen, before visiting Walzâ€™s social studies class. Alliance Times-Herald reported that after visiting Walzâ€™s classroom, the Chinese delegation was slated to watch Alliance High Schoolâ€™s basketball team practice and also had plans to visit local ranches.
â€œIt is interesting to see so much open space. It [America] impresses us a lot,â€ Ning Ziheng said, according to Alliance Times-Herald. â€œWe think this area is more agricultural. We like this kind of environment.â€
Before visiting Nebraska, the delegation toured an unspecified Los Angeles high school, according to Alliance Times-Herald. During a third leg of the trip, the delegation reportedly aimed to visit the University of Northern Iowa.
Ye Guoqiang and Yi Hongtao could not be reached for comment.
â€˜Grooming, Wooing, And Romancingâ€™
The Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education where the three members of the delegation worked â€” or had worked previously â€” is listed as a member unit of a Chinese influence and intelligence service, Chinese government records reveal.
The Guangdong provincial branch of the Chinese Peopleâ€™s Association For Friendship With Foreign Countries (CPAFFC) has repeatedly listed the Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education as a â€œgroup member,â€ including at the time of the 1996 Chinese delegation visit to Nebraska during CPAFFCâ€™s 6th and 7th congresses, which lasted between 1995 and 2005.
Federal authorities characterize CPAFFC as an â€œaffiliateâ€ or â€œsubordinateâ€ of a Chinese influence and intelligence service called the United Front Work Department (UFWD). In 2020, the State Department warned that CPAFFC is a â€œBeijing-based organization tasked with co-opting subnational governmentsâ€ that has â€œsought to directly and malignly influence state and local leaders to promote the PRCâ€™s global agenda.â€
Over the years, CPAFFC has held numerous sports events for visiting foreign groups at Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education, and, as recently as 2023, reselected the institute as a member unit.
At the time of the Chinese delegationâ€™s 1996 Nebraska visit, the dean of Guangzhou Institute of Physical Education was a CCP official named Chen Shuhua, who then also served as a Guangdong CPAFFC director, Chinese government records show.
Walz had met Chen Shuhua in China at least once before the Chinese delegationâ€™s 1996 visit, and the DCNF discovered that several trips Walz led to China also visited the institute.
A 1995 Alliance High School yearbook pictures Walz, Chen Shuhua and Ning Ziheng together during the schoolâ€™s second trip to China sharing â€œa toast of health and prosperity.â€ The yearbook photoâ€™s caption identifies Chen Shuhua as â€œPresident of Guangzhou Institute of Physical Educationâ€ and Ning Ziheng as an â€œAssociate Professor of Sports Psychology and main host for the China Trip.â€
Walz and his wife met Ning Ziheng as early as 1992, according to a May 26, 1993 Alliance Times-Herald article concerning a then-upcoming trip to China led by Walz.
â€œThe two have been in contact with Mr. Ning Ziheng in regard to this program since August of 1992,â€ Alliance Times-Herald reported.
â€œThe group is headed for China, with a special invitation from the Chinese government,â€ the Star-Herald reported on July 25, 1993. â€œWalz got the idea while working as a teacher in China three years ago. A friend helped contact the authorities, and funding came through the government this April.â€
During this 1993 trip, Walz also apparently took his students to Guangzhou Institute of Sports Education and met with Ning Ziheng, according to a review of local Nebraska newspapers.
â€œMost of the groupâ€™s time will be spent at Guangzhou University, where the students will play sports and take classes in Chinese culture,â€ the Star-Herald reported.
On Aug. 19. 1993, the Alliance Times-Herald reported students had visited â€œthe University of Guangzhou,â€ with â€œMr. Ningâ€ serving as the tripâ€™s tour guide.
â€œMy favorite thing about the trip was the people!â€ one trip participant told the paper. â€œEverybody really liked our guide, Mr. Ning. He was the kind of person who nobody could walk away from without being his friend.â€
Walz â€œknew some Chinese officials who agreed to help set up the tour,â€ Omaha World-Herald reported in August 1993, with the Star-Herald later reporting that the trip had been â€œarranged by a friend of Walz in Chinaâ€™s foreign affairs department.â€
The Omaha World-Herald reported Walz led his 1993 trip participants to Guangzhouâ€™s Shamian Island.
The tiny, roughly 75-acre island is home to the headquarters of Guangdong CPAFFC, according to its archived website. Today, the Guangdong Foreign Affairs Office shares a website with Guangdong CPAFFC.
The Alliance Times-Herald reported that in 1993 Walzâ€™s group visited the White Swan Hotel, which is located less than 1,000 feet from Guangdong CPAFFCâ€™s headquarters on Shamian Island.
â€œThe White Swan Hotel, a five star hotel, was an interesting place to visit,â€ one trip participant said, according to Alliance Times-Herald.
In 1994, Walz again helped lead a trip to China and took students to play sports at the â€œGuangzhou Institute,â€ the Chadron Record reported.
Walz also continued to bring students to China to meet with Ning Ziheng after he and his wife moved to Minnesota in 1996 to begin teaching at Mankato West High School, the DCNF found.
One undated photo posted by the â€œMankato West High School Alumni For Walzâ€ Facebook group shows Ning Ziheng and Walz with students in front of the Ruins of St. Paulâ€™s in Macao, China.
Ning Ziheng also apparently visited Walz in Minnesota on April 4, 1998, according to a photo included in a May 2021 social media post by Chinese-language news outlet Today Macao. The photo appears to show Ning Ziheng beside Walz at Mall of America in Bloomington, Minnesota, playing miniature golf.
â€œBegan golfing under a friendâ€™s guidance,â€ the photoâ€™s caption reads.
Ning Ziheng has since become a semi-professional golfer and has starred in short films about teaching golf to his sons, produced by the propaganda departments of the General Administration of Sport of China, All-China Sports Federation and the Chinese Olympic Committee.
An undated photo included in an April 2021 Today Macao social media post taken at an unspecified location pictures Walz with Ning Zihengâ€™s two sons.
Ning Ziheng now serves as a professor of Health Sciences and Sports at Macao Polytechnic University where Walz disclosed previously working as a fellow.
Ning did not respond to multiple requests for comment.
â€œThe Communist Partyâ€™s United Front Work Department has been grooming, wooing, and romancing Tim Walz for four decades,â€ China expert and author Gordon Chang told the DCNF. â€œWe cannot allow our enemy to take over the core of our government.â€
â€˜An End In Itselfâ€™
Walzâ€™s relationship with CCP officials may cause him to overlook inappropriate ties between other U.S. lawmakers and CCP officials, says Steve Yates, senior research fellow for China and National Security Policy at the Heritage Foundation.
â€œFor decades many American leaders â€” whether from academia, business or government â€” argued that engagement with the CCP was a necessary means to the desirable end of reaching the Chinese people and achieving a better and safer future together,â€ Yates told the DCNF. â€œAn elegant and tempting ideal.â€
In the last three months, the House Oversight Committee has sent multiple letters to federal authorities concerning Walzâ€™s close relationship with China and its political mechanisms. An August 2024 letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray requests information pertaining to matters such as â€œany warnings or advice the FBI may have given to Governor Walz about U.S. political figures being targeted by or recruited for CCP influence operations.â€
More recently, Comer sent a subpoena to Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas, alleging that whistleblower disclosures notified â€œthe Committee of serious concern among Department of Homeland Security (DHS) personnel regarding a longstanding connection between the CCP and Minnesota Governor Timothy James Walz.â€
Walz was recently also forced to admit heâ€™s made several false statements concerning his China travels, following a bombshell September 2024 report from Minnesota Public Radio.
Walz previously stated heâ€™d traveled to China â€œabout 30 times,â€ however, when pressed, a Walz spokesman told Minnesota Public Radio that the actual number of trips was â€œcloser to 15.â€
Minnesota Public Radioâ€™s report also revealed that Walz was not in Hong Kong in May 1989 as the Tiananmen Square protests were intensifying as previously claimed. Rather, Walz was still in Nebraska at that time and didnâ€™t travel to China until August 1989 to begin teaching at the No. 1 Middle School in Guangdong provinceâ€™s city of Foshan, located directly southwest of Guangzhou.
Walz called himself a â€œknuckleheadâ€ and admitted he â€œmisspokeâ€ when a moderator asked him about the discrepancy during the CBS vice presidential debate.
Tim Walz on His China Trips: â€œI got there [China] that summer and misspoke on this.â€ pic.twitter.com/03UIFK1F1Y
â€” DC Shorts (@theDCshorts) October 2, 2024
Walz has also attended several events organized by members of a CCP intel-tied nonprofit in recent years, and, while serving as governor, appointed a member of a political faction loyal to the CCP to a state board on Asian-American affairs, the DCNF reported.
â€œOver such a long period of time, responsible leaders would ask, who did you end up engaging and empowering and to what actual end?â€ Yates said. â€œWalz cannot afford to ask these questions, because for him, engagement with the CCP was an end in itself. He cannot point to where his counterparts are today and say they are making China or the U.S. a better or safer place courtesy of his decades of friendly engagement with the CCP.â€

title: Kamalaâ€™s Last-Ditch Pitch To Black Men Is A Dream For Scammers, Fraudsters
content:
Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™s plan to offer $20,000 in forgivable loans to minority entrepreneurs is a golden opportunity for scammers and fraudsters, experts told the Daily Caller.
Harris announced the plan in early October as part of her â€œOpportunity Agenda for Black Men.â€ It promises to â€œensure that Black men can build wealth and achieve economic successâ€ by providing one million loans, fully forgivable and worth up to $20,000 each, to black entrepreneurs â€œand others who have historically faced barriers to starting a new business or growing an existing business.â€
The loans would be in partnership with the Small Business Administration (SBA), which also oversaw the administration of the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP), a COVID-era program meant to give small businesses resources â€œto maintain their payroll, hire back employees who may have been laid off, and cover applicable overhead.â€
That program, however, was the target of a sprawling fraud scheme which was â€œthe single largest transfer of money to criminal groups in our history,â€ Haywood Talcove, the CEO of LexisNexis Risk Solutions Government, told the Daily Caller.
The rate of fraud under COVID-era payment plans like PPP was â€œconservatively 20 percentâ€ and â€œprobably closer to 35 percent,â€ Talcove told the Caller. Given the efforts of large transnational criminal organizations, Talcove said, it could be as high as 50 percent. If Harrisâ€™s plan saw similar rates of fraud, it would cost the taxpayer billions of dollars. (Stream â€˜CLEANING UP KAMALAâ€™ Now)
Of the potentially hundreds of billions of dollars Talcove estimates people stole through COVID programs, the government has only recovered $13 billion, he told the Caller.
In fact, PPP fraud, and exploitation of the similar COVID-19 Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL), has been so rampant that the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee (PRAC) extended the statute of limitation on the crime from five years to 10 in 2023.
In addition to the fraud perpetrated by transnational groups, who Talcove says come from countries like China, Russia, Nigeria and Romania, Americans appeared to exploit COVID relief extensively as well.
The government fully forgave PPP loans that went alleged businesses such as â€œFree Money LLC,â€ an apparently New York-based company who had $15,000 in PPP loans forgiven in 2021, according to Pro Publica. (RELATED: Man Sentenced To 9 Years In Prison After Fraudulently Using $1.6 Million In PPP Loans On Cars, Rolex)
Other eyebrow-raising corporations to receive forgiveness included â€œMoney Makes Money Inc.â€ and â€œNig Corp.â€
Something like this? https://t.co/HUFW4dCpqg pic.twitter.com/wC8HzzTj5h
â€” Confirmed Miscer âš”ï¸ğŸğŸ”« (@ManDaveJobGood) October 14, 2024
In 2023, the PRAC also found 69,323 potentially ineligible social security numbers who had received PPP loans, according to a report.
Harrisâ€™s new plan appears just as likely to fall victim to exploitation.
â€œAnytime you have a government-sponsored subsidy that is going to a massive amount of people, the probability for improper payments and fraud is 100 percent,â€ Talcove said.
â€œHistory has shown us that when big sums of money are quickly rolled out with inadequate oversight, we open the door to fraud and abuse,â€ Republican Texas Rep. Michael Cloud told the Daily Caller.
Criminals are already talking about how theyâ€™re going to exploit the program on platforms like Telegram, Talcove said.
Twitter users have also been quick to point out how easily they believe it will be to defraud the government.
â€œI think Kamala Harris just announced we can run the PPP loan scam again if she get in office,â€ one user wrote.
I think Kamala Harris just announced we can run the PPP loan scam again if she get in office. ğŸ‘€ğŸ‘€ğŸ‘€ pic.twitter.com/N9OflMuvzG
â€” Easy Money ğŸ’³ğŸ’ (@Bitcoin_Teej) October 14, 2024
â€œ$20,000 isnâ€™t even enough money to launch a food truck, but it is just the right amount to buy a used car or nice vacation while being too small to justify any serious investigation into its misuse,â€ another said.
$20,000 isnâ€™t even enough money to launch a food truck, but it is just the right amount to buy a used car or nice vacation while being too small to justify any serious investigation into its misuse. https://t.co/NYCH1yWf7m
â€” AnechoicMedia (@AnechoicMedia_) October 15, 2024
The federal government has taken almost no responsibility for the fraud.
Republican Kentucky Rep. James Comer and the House Oversight Committee, which Rep. Cloud is a member of, did probe COVID fraud and found close to $200 billion in stolen funds.
I will get the backs of Americaâ€™s taxpayers.
That is why on February 1, @GOPoversight will hold our first hearing titled â€œFederal Pandemic Spending: A Prescription for Waste, Fraud, and Abuse,â€ to focus on the rampant waste of taxpayer $$$ in COVID relief programs. @BloombergTV pic.twitter.com/WZWhsrhyrK
â€” Rep. James Comer (@RepJamesComer) January 28, 2023
â€œThe Biden-Harris Administration allowed fraud to run rampant in federal unemployment programs and is now moving fast to make the pandemic unemployment programs permanent,â€ Comer wrote in a report.
Despite the committeeâ€™s recommendations, which include prioritizing antiquated IT systems and verifying claimantsâ€™ proof of work, there is still a lack of federal accountability for the programs, Cloud told the Caller.
â€œA forgivable loan theoretically comes with conditions that must be met, such as job creation or measurable contributions to the economy, to be forgiven. In practice, though, many of these programs end up functioning like handouts because they lack the rigorous oversight needed to ensure real accountability,â€ Cloud said.
Talcove concurred. (RELATED: â€˜Riggedâ€™: Death Of The American Voter | WATCH NOW)
â€œWhen thereâ€™s an emergency, like there was with COVID, [the government says] weâ€™ll go get the money later. Weâ€™ll stop the criminals later, right? But the fact of the matter is, pay and chase, it doesnâ€™t work.â€
â€œNo one ever talks about the victim,â€ Talcove, who told the Caller his mother was a victim of stolen identity, said. â€œThese are not victimless crimes. Thereâ€™s somebody that needed the benefit, whose identity was purchased on the dark web for pennies that couldnâ€™t get what they deserved.â€
In addition to being vulnerable to fraud, Harrisâ€™ race-based plan is also â€œunconstitutional,â€ Rep. Cloud said.
â€œ[Itâ€™s] a ridiculous thing to propose when our country is currently incredibly divided and all Americans are struggling to afford essentials under her administration,â€ he said.

title: Harris Completes Pivot To Failed â€˜Democracyâ€™ Message With Speech At J6 Site
content:
WASHINGTON, D.C. â€“ Vice President Kamala Harris used her closing argument, one week out from the election, to complete a messaging pivot at the Ellipse, where Trump once addressed his supporters hours before the Jan. 6 Capitol Riot.
Harris, surrounded by her usual â€œfreedomâ€ signage, told tens of thousands of her supporters that Trump was â€œobsessed with revenge,â€ is a â€œpetty tyrantâ€ and would seek to use the military against his enemies if elected to the White House on Nov. 5. The vice president, adding that the former president was â€œout for unchecked powerâ€ and had an enemies list, further drew on the location of her speech within the first few minutes of her closing argument to try to prove Trump is such.
Harrisâ€™ closing arguments displayed a larger campaign message in the final weeks of the election, one that has shifted from one of â€œjoyâ€ to that of calling Trump a fascist, â€œunhinged,â€ â€œunstableâ€ and unfit to lead.
â€œLook, we know who Donald Trump is. He is the person who stood at this very spot nearly four years ago and sent an armed mob to the United States Capitol to overturn the will of the people in a free and fair election,â€ Harris said.
â€œDonald Trump has told us his priorities for a second term. He has an enemies list of people he intends to prosecute. He says one of his highest priorities is to set free the violent extremists who assaulted those law enforcement officers on January 6th,â€ the continued.
Harrisâ€™ final message is one that closely mirrors President Joe Bidenâ€™s campaign messaging of pinning Trump down as a â€œthreat to democracy,â€ which often touched on the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol riot to illustrate their point.
The Daily Caller spoke to several rally goers at Harris rally, some of who echoed the vice presidentâ€™s message that â€œdemocracyâ€ was on the line in the 2024 election and feared a dangerous Trump if he was elected.
â€œI think itâ€™s our democracy [that is at stake,]â€ Jason Vaughn, a nurse practitioner from the south visiting D.C. for the rally and work, told the Caller, â€œI believe Trump is a fascist.â€
â€œI think he has figured out that he has all this power, and the Supreme Court has told him he can do whatever he wants, and I think he is going to run with that if he is around. Itâ€™s do or die,â€ Marcus Reed, a government employee who lives in D.C., told the Caller.
While her supporters worried about the potential of Trump with unchecked power, the vice president told them in her speech that he could weaponize the military against them.
â€œDonald Trump intends to use the United States military against American citizens who simply disagree with him. People he calls â€” quote â€” â€˜the enemy from within.â€™ This is not a candidate for President who is thinking about how to make your life better,â€ she said.
â€œThis is someone who is unstable, obsessed with revenge, consumed with grievance, and out for unchecked power,â€ Harris continued.
Bidenâ€™s messaging reportedly made top Democrats anxious as it wasnâ€™t landing with voters, but still the campaign continued with it. At one point, Biden met with historians to help frame his speeches around â€œthe ongoing threats to democracy and democratic institutions both here in America and around the world, as well as the opportunities we face as a nation,â€ the White House previously said.
Itâ€™s something Biden has continued to parrot despite dropping out of the race. White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters Wednesday that the president thinks Trump is a fascist.
â€œYou have heard from this president over and over again about the threats to democracy,â€ Jean-Pierre said. â€œAnd the president has spoken about that. You have heard from the former president himself that he is going to be a dictator on day one. This is him, not us. This is him.â€
About an hour before, Harris had unexpectedly given remarks from her residence in response to a report from The New York Times and The Atlantic. Both outlets conducted interviews with former Trump chief of staff John Kelly, who said the former president â€œmet the definition of a fascistâ€ and admired figures like former Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler.
The Atlantic article citing Kellyâ€™s comments additionally alleged that Trump disparaged a deceased veteran and her family. The Trump campaign alongside former officials, the deceased veteranâ€™s family and their lawyer have all gone on the record to deny the story.
Harris has repeatedly spoken about Kellyâ€™s comments anyways.
â€œIt is clear from John Kellyâ€™s words that Donald Trump is someone who, I quote, â€˜certainly falls into the general definition of fascist.â€™ Who vowed to be a dictator on day one and vowed to use the military as his personal militia to carry out his personal and political vendettas,â€ the vice president said.
â€œDonald Trump is increasingly unhinged and unstable, and in a second term, people like John Kelly would not be there to be the guard rails against his propensities and his actions,â€ she continued.
Kamala Harris, who calls Trump a fascist, and Joe Biden, who calls Trumpâ€™s supporters garbage, have something to say about the divisiveness of Trumpâ€™s rhetoric.
â€” David Sacks (@DavidSacks) October 30, 2024
A few hours after her remarks and Jean-Pierreâ€™s comments, the vice president said she believed Trump was a fascist.
â€œYou quoted General Milly calling Trump a fascist. You yourself have not used that word to describe him. Let me ask you tonight, do you think Donald Trump is a fascist?â€ CNN host Anderson Cooper asked Harris.
â€œYes, I do,â€ Harris said without hesitation. â€œAnd I also believe that the people who know him best on this subject should be trusted.â€
But since Harris has pivoted to the message that seemingly played into Bidenâ€™s demise, her own party has started to fret about the vice presidentâ€™s election chances.
â€œIt doesnâ€™t play well in communities that are struggling to make ends meet, and thatâ€™s the problem. Theyâ€™re talking to the wrong people,â€ Sherry Gay-Dagnogo, a former state representative and Detroit school board member who is backing Harris, told Politico. â€œWe canâ€™t keep campaigning on modes of fear.â€
I made a promise to the people of our country: I will fight for you, regardless of who you vote for, and be a president for all Americans. Here is my closing argument. https://t.co/rOqLcTB0TR
â€” Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) October 29, 2024
During her speech, the vice president drew parallels between the 2024 election to the American revolution, as in both situations, she argued power needed to be wrestled from a â€œpetty tyrant.â€
â€œJust like I always have. Nearly 250 years ago, America was born when we wrested freedom from a petty tyrant,â€ she said. â€œAcross the generations, Americans have: Preserved that freedom. Expanded it. And in so doing, proved to the world that a government of, by and for the people is strong and can endure. And those who came before us â€” the patriots at Normandy and Selma. Seneca Falls and Stonewall. On farmlands and factory floors.â€
â€œThey did not struggle, sacrifice and lay down their lives, only to see us cede our fundamental freedoms, only to see us submit to the will of another petty tyrant,â€ Harris continued.
Taylor, a Maryland woman in case management supporting Harris at her D.C. rally, expressed fear at the thought of Trump being president. The Caller omitted Taylorâ€™s last name for the sake of anonymity to allow her to discuss her views freely.
â€œItâ€™s scary to think that Donald Trump will be back in office, and Project 2025, he is saying he isnâ€™t using it but it was written, so thatâ€™s scary,â€ Taylor told the Caller.
Other Harris supporters at the Ellipse thought that the very rights they hold today could disappear if Trump reaches the White House again.
â€œEveryoneâ€™s freedoms,â€ a Maryland woman in the travel industry, given anonymity to speak freely, told the Caller. â€œEven the right to vote.â€

title: UK Socialist Leader Insists Heâ€™s Still Good Friends With Trump After Party Staffers Plan Trip To Help Harris
content:
United Kingdom (U.K.) Prime Minister Keir Starmer â€” a self-admitted socialist â€” is insisting heâ€™s very good friends with former President Donald Trump, even as Trumpâ€™s campaign has recently filed a complaint against Starmerâ€™s party for sending staffers to campaign for Kamala Harris.
There were reports last week that a high-level Labour Party staffer was organizing a trip to fly approximately 100 party staffers into the U.S. to campaign on behalf of Harrisâ€™ campaign, raising concerns about potential foreign election interference. Trumpâ€™s campaign filed a legal complaint against the Labour Party following the reports, but Starmer brushed aside concerns that the move was illegal and assured reporters on Wednesday that he was still â€œgood friendsâ€ with Trump, according to multiple reports. (RELATED: â€˜Unacceptableâ€™: County Fires Election Worker After Republican Spots Ballot Security Lapse In Realtime)
Starmer is now the prime minister of the U.K. after the Labour Party won the countryâ€™s elections in July, ousting the Conservative Party and former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak from power. Starmer will have to work with either Trump or Harris on maintaining U.S.-U.K. relations depending on which candidate wins in the November presidential elections.
â€œI spent time in New York with President Trump, had dinner with him and my purpose in doing that was to make sure that between the two of us, we established a good relationship, which we did,â€ Starmer told reporters. â€œWe had a good, constructive discussion and, of course, as prime minister of the United Kingdom I will work with whoever the American people return as their president.â€
Starmer also told reporters that Labour had sent staffers to volunteer in previous U.S. elections, according to reports.
â€œTheyâ€™re doing it in their spare time, theyâ€™re doing it as volunteers, theyâ€™re staying I think with other volunteers over there. Thatâ€™s what theyâ€™ve done in previous elections, thatâ€™s what theyâ€™re doing in this election and thatâ€™s really straightforward,â€ Starmer said.
The Labour Party said it isnâ€™t funding the trip and that staffers choosing to go campaign on behalf of Harris have to go on their own dime, according to Politico EU.
The rules and regulations surrounding how foreign nationals can participate in the U.S. election process are strict. Besides the obvious law prohibiting foreign nationals from voting in a U.S. election, they also cannot donate to a political campaign, according to the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Foreign nationals can volunteer for a campaign, but they cannot be a part of the decision-making process as to how the campaign should operate.
The Labour Party insists its staffer trip to the U.S. is in compliance with these laws, according to Politico EU. But the Trump campaign feels there are aspects to the trip that may be crossing the line.
â€œThose searching for foreign interference in our elections need to look no further than [the] LinkedIn post,â€ the Trump campaign wrote in a legal complaint to the FEC.
The Trump campaign did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: â€˜Iâ€™ve Heard It All Beforeâ€™: Scott Jennings Lists Republicans Who Democrats Compared To Hitler In The Past
content:
Republican strategist Scott Jennings said Wednesday night that heâ€™s â€œheardâ€ comparisons of prominent Republicans to German dictator Adolf Hitler going back to the George W. Bush administration during a panel on CNN.
Vice President Kamala Harris used a Wednesday press conference to highlight claims from an article in The Atlantic that former President Donald Trump expressed a desire for generals like those who served under Hitler. Jennings told Jamal Simmons, a former aide to Harris, that he was â€œcallousedâ€ to Hitler comparisons. (RELATED: â€˜You Donâ€™t Need To Interruptâ€™: Sparks Fly Between Scott Jennings And WaPo Columnist Over Trump, IVF)
â€œNow, Iâ€™m calloused on this Hitler business because I lived through the Bush years and I used to peer out my window onto Pennsylvania Avenue and I saw everybody marching around in their brown uniforms, signs up, â€˜Bush is Hitler, Bush is Hitler,â€™â€ Jennings said. â€œAnd then they did it to John McCain. They did it to Mitt Romney. Theyâ€™ve done it to Donald Trump. Even did it to Paul Ryan, I recall at one point. So Iâ€™ve heard it all before.â€
WATCH:
Prior to listing Republicans who Democrats had compared to the Nazi leader, Jennings noted that vulnerable Democratic Senators were touting their ability to work with Trump.
â€œIt probably will shock Kamala Harris and the rest of her campaign staff to learn that there are incumbent Democrat U.S. senators in this country right now running television ads touting all their work with this modern-day Hitler,â€ Jennings said, later adding, â€œI mean, if he were really Hitler, if he were really a threat to democracy, not a single Democrat in this country would be running ads touting their work with Donald Trump.â€
Jennings then said that anti-Israel protests on college campuses where demonstrators made statements like â€œresistance is justifiedâ€ and chanted â€œfrom the river to the sea, Palestine will be free,â€ a slogan that has connotations of wiping out Israel, made antisemitism appear to be coming from left-wing sources. (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œPoisoned Iviesâ€)
â€œI think the reason Democrats are freaking out about it right now is because what they have learned is that itâ€˜s not Republicans who are the Hitlers or the Nazis, itâ€˜s actually emanating from within their own party,â€ Jennings said. â€œIf you want to find Hitler-ish, Nazi-esque antisemitic tendencies, look on the left, not on the right.â€
When Simmons claimed Jennings was trying to dodge the point about Trump, Jennings cut him off.
â€œShe literally spoke in front of the Naval Observatory today, â€˜Trump is Hitler,â€™â€ Jennings said in reference to Harris.

title: CNNâ€™s Harry Enten Says â€˜Movementâ€™ Toward Trump â€˜Among A Key Blocâ€™ In Crucial States â€˜Gives Democrats Some Agitaâ€™
content:
CNN senior data reporter Harry Enten said Wednesday that he thinks former President Donald Trumpâ€™s gains with independents in Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin are making Democrats uneasy.
Trump currently holds narrow leads over Vice President Kamala Harris in all three states, according to RealClearPolling averages. Enten, on â€œCNN News Central,â€ noted Trump is now slightly leading among independents in these battleground states, a shift from 2020 when he trailed President Joe Biden with this demographic. (RELATED: Former Clinton Pollster Says Harrisâ€™ â€˜Inauthenticityâ€™ Is â€˜The Larger Problem She Facesâ€™ In Election)
WATCH:
â€œWhat do we know about independents, right? Center of the electorate. You go last time around Joe Biden won these voters by 11 points. You look at September of 2024, a month ago, Kamala Harris was up five points among independents. You look now though, look at this. Sheâ€™s only up by two points among a key bloc, center of the electorate, down nine points from where Biden was at the end of the 2020 campaign,â€ Enten told host John Berman. â€œOf course, this is a national picture â€¦ What is going on in those key battleground states, Michigan, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, the Great Lakes, that blue wall, right?â€
â€œJoe Biden, last time around, won â€™em by five points over Donald Trump. Look at where we are today. This is the type of movement Donald Trump likes to see in the center of the electorate, up by a point. Now, of course, thatâ€™s well within any margin of error, right? But again, itâ€˜s the movement. Itâ€™s the trend, Mr. Berman, that weâ€™re looking at,â€ he added. â€œAnd when you flip a group from going plus five Biden to now plus one Trump. Thatâ€™s the type of movement Donald Trump loves to see, and itâ€™s the type of movement that I think gives Democrats some agita.â€
Enten also asserted presidential candidates who win with independent voters typically secure an election victory, though not always.
â€œWhy are we seeing this movement in the electorate, perhaps away from the Democrats towards Donald Trump? And this is true overall, this is true among independents as well. View as too liberal, right? Are you out of the mainstream, perhaps? 38% said that of Joe Biden back in 2020, now that number is up to 48% for Kamala Harris versus the 40% or so who see Trump as too conservative,â€ he added. â€œThe bottom line is Harris may be a little bit too out of the mainstream, at least compared to Donald Trump when weâ€™re talking ideologically speaking.â€
Harris supported many left-wing policies during her 2020 presidential bid, but reversed some of her stances since launching her 2024 campaign in July. Her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, also has a far-left record on issues such as immigration and transgender policy.
Trump also currently leads Harris in the other four top swing states, according to the RealClearPolling averages. Journalist Mark Halperin asserted Tuesday that Trump will be president-elect on Nov. 5 if the present early voting trajectory persists.
â€œMake no mistake, if these numbers hold up in the states where we can understand even partially what the data is like, weâ€™ll know that Donald Trumpâ€™s going to be president on Election Day,â€ he said.

title: Blue State To Offer Free Birth Control Using Multimillion Dollar Taxpayer Fund
content:
Michigan Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer launched a new program in her state Wednesday offering free birth control to all residents.
The â€œTake Control of your Birth Controlâ€ program will provide Michiganders with condoms, over-the-counter oral contraceptives and emergency contraception starting in November until supplies run out, according to a press release. The program is being administered by Michiganâ€™s Department of Health and Human Services, which was awarded $5.6 million in taxpayer funds to expand family planning services, according to the stateâ€™s budget.
â€œEveryone, no matter how much money they make, deserves to make their own decisions about their own reproductive health and future,â€ Whitmer said in the press release. â€œWith our family planning initiative, â€˜Take Control of Your Birth Control,â€™ we are building on our work to protect reproductive freedom for all Michiganders. By expanding access to essential family planning tools, we are underscoring our commitment to ensuring Michiganders, along with their families and trusted health care providers, can make their own decisions about their own bodies and lives.â€
The Biden-Harris administration on Monday called for private insurance companies to cover the cost of over-the-counter birth control through the Affordable Care Act, which Whitmer praised on X in an announcement for the new Michigan program. (â€˜Buy Votesâ€™: Michigan Republicans Blast State Dems For Trying To Keep Residents On Dole As Election Looms)
Weâ€™re excited to announce this program here in Michigan as @POTUS and @VP have just proposed expanding insurance coverage of birth control. Together, weâ€™re ensuring families have access to the resources they need and protecting reproductive freedom.
â€” Governor Gretchen Whitmer (@GovWhitmer) October 23, 2024
The governor has been a vocal pro-abortion advocate, suggesting she supports the practice through all nine months and even sued prosecutors in her state in 2022 in an attempt to enshrine abortion into the state constitution. The state passed a constitutional amendment that November legalizing abortion through 24 weeks of pregnancy and making it illegal to penalize doctors that perform the procedure.
Whitmerâ€™s office did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Feds Fund â€˜Environmental Justiceâ€™ Literacy And â€˜LGBTQ+â€™ Health In Chicago Public Schools As Students Fall Behind
content:
Roughly 40% of public school students in Chicago are chronically absent, commonly defined as missing at least 10% of days in a given school year, and the vast majority of the students actually showing up to class lack proficiency in math and reading. Amid these conditions, CPS asked federal agencies for funds to increase studentsâ€™ â€œliteracy for environmental justiceâ€ and to improve â€œmental health equityâ€ for racial minority and â€œLGBTQ+â€ pupils, according to government spending records.
The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) awarded over $400,000 to CPS in August after the district requested funds to help improve the health of its â€œLGBTQ+â€ and newcomer students, according to government spending records. The six-figure grant will help address the issues that arise from higher rates of risky sexual behavior, drug usage and worse mental health statuses among LGBT students. (Stream The Daily Callerâ€™s documentary â€˜Cleaning Up Kamalaâ€™ HERE)
Even as the proportion of chronically absent students remains high, and as test scores remain low, CPS boasts a graduation rate of 83%. The Illinois Policy Institute, a right-of-center think tank, has accused CPS of â€œpromoting students who havenâ€™t mastered critical skillsâ€ and argued that doing so â€œis unfair to those students and sets them up for frustration later in life.â€
Another grant appeal CPS made to HHS cites the disproportionately poor health outcomes of black and â€œLatinxâ€ students to request resources to fund â€œtraining for [a] mental health equityâ€ program that â€œlinks mental health awareness with a foundational understanding of bias-based harm,â€ records show. The grant, worth nearly a half million dollars and awarded to the district in August, will train school administrators to improve their proficiency in â€œrecognizing, preventing, responding to and transforming incidents of bias and discrimination.â€
As of 2023, over 80% of CPS students between third and eighth grade failed to meet grade-level standards for math with roughly three-quarters failing to meet the standards for reading, according to the Illinois Policy Institute. While students struggle with basic literacy in Chicago, the school board has appealed to the federal government to foster â€œliteracy for environmental justiceâ€ among students, according to federal records.
The Department of Commerce (DOC) approved a $75,000 grant proposal from CPS to prepare students for â€œsuccess in civic lifeâ€ by teaching them to investigate and understand â€œscientific solutions which build resilience to extreme weather and climate change,â€ according to federal spending records.
As CPS requested financial assistance to fund environmental and racial justice, the district faced a half-billion-dollar deficit coming into this school year, The Washington Post reported. The financial shortfall was the product of CPSâ€™ refusal to make spending cuts as the districtâ€™s $2.8 billion in COVID-19 relief funding dries up. Even as the district faces an uncertain financial future, the local teachersâ€™ union is pushing for more hiring and increased pay.
â€œThis is what it looks like when you burn a district down,â€ Georgetown University education professor Marguerite Roza told The Post. â€œIt is a level of dysfunction that feels beyond destabilizing, enough to make people lose confidence in the system.â€

title: â€˜Heâ€™s Not Helpingâ€™: Ex-CNN Analyst Says Bidenâ€™s Call To â€˜Lockâ€™ Trump â€˜Upâ€™ Is â€˜Absolutely Bad For Kamala Harrisâ€™
content:
Former CNN political analyst Chris Cillizza said Wednesday that President Joe Bidenâ€™s comment about having to â€œlock [former President Donald Trump] upâ€ is damaging to Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ campaign.

Lock him out, thatâ€™s what we have to do.â€™ Yeah, thatâ€™s the ticket,â€ Cillizza said. â€œUh, come on, man, like we, â€˜Politically lock him up,â€™ what the hell does that mean? When the president of the United States says, â€˜We gotta lock him upâ€™ about the former president of the United States, who has premised almost his entire political life on the idea that the Democrats and the â€˜deep stateâ€™ are trying to lock him up, I mean, itâ€™s really not good.â€

â€œI do not think Joe Biden is running a secret conspiracy to make Kamala Harris lose, but I do think that when you say things like â€˜We gotta lock him up,â€™ â€˜gotta lock him upâ€™ about Donald Trump two weeks before an election, it affirms everything Donald Trump has been arguing,â€ Cillizza said later. â€œIt makes the Republican base even more rabid to turn out, right? As if they werenâ€™t rabid enough â€” theyâ€™re pretty rabid to turn out. Theyâ€™re going to be even more rabid, so heâ€™s not helping.â€

The Biden-Harris Administrationâ€™s border and immigration policies only increase the likelihood that such aliens will successfully enter and remain in the U.S. Pursuant to the Rules of the House of Representatives, the Committee on the Judiciary is authorized to conduct oversight of federal immigration policy and procedures,â€ Jordan wrote in the letter. title: Florida Sues Biden-Harris DOJ For Allegedly Blocking Trump Assassination Attempt Investigation
content:
Florida sued the Biden-Harris administrationâ€™s Department of Justice (DOJ) Wednesday for allegedly blocking the stateâ€™s investigation into the second Trump assassination attempt.
Federal officials almost immediately began â€œtaking steps to halt the stateâ€™s investigationâ€ into Ryan Wesley Routh, who was indicted for attempting to assassinate former President Donald Trump at his Florida golf course in September, the lawsuit states.
â€œEvery day that Florida is prevented from investigating, the Stateâ€™s case becomes harder to prove at trial,â€ the lawsuit states. â€œBy contrast, the federal government suffers no injury from Florida investigating state law crimes, as the State has no intention of interfering with or obstructing the federal investigation.â€ (RELATED: Trump Assassination Attempt Suspect Seeks Judgeâ€™s Recusal From Case)
Republican Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signed an executive order two days after the Sept. 15 attempt directing Florida law enforcement agencies to investigate and ensure violations of state law were referred for prosecution.
Attorney General Ashley Moody wrote a letter Sept. 23 to FBI Director Christopher Wray indicating it would be a â€œmistakeâ€ to frustrate Floridaâ€™s investigation.
In a Sept. 30 response, U.S. Attorney Lapointe said the state cannot conduct investigative activities until the federal prosecution is complete, according to the lawsuit. Federal officials indicated that activities like interviewing potential witnesses are illegal under federal law, the lawsuit states.
Routh was initially charged with two gun offenses. The DOJ later charged him with attempted assassination on Sept. 24.
The statute Routh was charged under states that local authority will be suspended once federal jurisdiction is asserted.
The DOJ declined to comment on the lawsuit.

title: â€˜You Donâ€™t Need To Interruptâ€™: Sparks Fly Between Scott Jennings And WaPo Columnist Over Trump, IVF
content:
Republican strategist Scott Jennings clashed with Washington Post columnist Catherine Rampell Monday night over former President Donald Trumpâ€™s support of in-vitro fertilization (IVF).
Trump vowed to make IVF free if elected during an August campaign event in Michigan. Rampell expressed skepticism about Trumpâ€™s position while on a panel during â€œCNN News Night.â€ (RELATED: â€˜Iâ€™ll Have To Speak Upâ€™: Scott Jennings, David Axelrod Get Into Verbal Brawl Over State Abortion Law)
â€œDonald Trumpâ€™s not running for state representative in any particular state. He is running for president, and heâ€™s made his position on this very clear,â€ Jennings said. â€œHeâ€™s got a very moderate, center-right, long-standing Republican position that goes back to Reagan. Heâ€™s pro-life, he believes in some moderate limits on weeks. He believes in the three exceptions for rape, incest, and life of the mother. He has been a champion, a champion for IVF.â€
WATCH:
â€œHe has not. Iâ€™m sorry, I need to interrupt â€”â€ Rampell said before Jennings interjected. â€œHe absolutely has. You donâ€™t need to interrupt because youâ€˜re wrong. He has been a champion in the party for speaking for IVF.â€
Trump called for IVF to be protected after the Alabama Supreme Court ruled on Feb. 16 that frozen embryos resulting from successful IVF procedures would be viewed as unborn children during a case involving three families suing a medical facility that destroyed the embryos. The Supreme Court declined to hear an appeal by the medical facility on Oct. 7.
â€œPeople watching, I wrote about this like two weeks ago, you can look at â€”â€ Rampell said, as Jennings interrupted, saying, â€œI listen to what he says all the time. He has â€”â€
â€œI look at his record. I look at his record,â€ Rampell responded as someone else tried to cut in, later adding, â€œLook at his actual record. For example, his recent statement saying, â€˜Oh, weâ€˜re going to make insurers cover IVF,â€™ you know that he led the initiative to repeal ObamaCare, which got rid of all essential health benefits, all requirements for insurers to cover any sort of health care. That would include IVF.â€
Rampell cited legislation proposed by Democrats to protect IVF, which Jennings dismissed as a â€œsham vote.â€
Republican Rep. Nancy Mace of South Carolina also introduced legislation to protect access to IVF and other fertility treatments shortly after the Alabama Supreme Courtâ€™s ruling.

title: â€˜Itâ€™s Horribleâ€™: Undecided Pennsylvania Voter Panel Unanimously Opposes Harris Calling Trump â€˜Fascistâ€™
content:
A focus group of eight undecided Pennsylvania voters on Thursday unanimously expressed disapproval of Vice President Kamala Harris referring to former President Donald Trump â€œas a fascist.â€
Harris said during a CNN town hall Wednesday that she thinks Trump is â€œa fascistâ€ in light of former White House chief of staff John Kelly telling The New York Times and The Atlantic that the former president exhibited â€œfascistâ€ tendencies and allegedly praised Adolf Hitler. Three of the voters, featured on journalist Mark Halperinâ€™s 2WAY platform, commented that Harrisâ€™ remarks were off-putting or unlikely to help her win the November election, while none of the eight raised their hands when Halperin asked if the vice president should be campaigning on this issue. (RELATED: Biden Campaigns On Trump Being A Threat To Democracy, But Voters May Not Be Buying It: POLL)
WATCH:
â€œIn the last few days, the vice president has started to talk about Donald Trump as a fascist, as someone whoâ€™s spoken approvingly of Hitler. Raise your hand if youâ€™ve heard about those comments,â€ Halperin directed, with all eight confirming they had. â€œOkay. What do folks think, is that something thatâ€™s persuasive to you, is that something that youâ€™ll factor into your vote?â€
â€œTo me, itâ€™s horrible that sheâ€™s saying that about him. If he was saying that about her, everybody would be up in arms,â€ a voter named Linda Wright answered. â€œI just donâ€™t think thatâ€™s right.â€
Halperin asked for more voter input, specifying that Harris was espousing the rhetoric â€œbased on accounts of people whoâ€™ve worked with President Trump.â€
â€œShe obviously thinks itâ€™s going to help her. I donâ€™t think it does it all,â€ a voter named Josh Cantor asserted. â€œI donâ€™t know why, if it was Kelly who heard the president say that, Iâ€™m not saying he did or he didnâ€™t, I donâ€™t think heâ€™d lie â€” I think you said that, Mark, on an episode â€” but I think that he had a responsibility to resign the day that was said if thatâ€™s true. I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s the case.â€
â€œI think part of the reason why Iâ€™m being pushed towards Trump so strongly is that I find that the Democrats and the left just keep going straight to Hitler all of the time with everything,â€ a voter named Karsten Chu said. â€œAnd if itâ€™s not the left pushing Hitler, itâ€™s the right pushing Stalin so itâ€™s like weâ€™re fighting World War II every single day for every single election so itâ€™s so exhausting. I think it just detracts from â€” it pushes me away from their position and it, you know, itâ€™s so hyperbolic that it makes it impossible to have good discussions and I think it ruins the discourse.â€
Halperin then asked voters to raise their hands if they believe â€œitâ€™s valuableâ€ or â€œimportantâ€ for Harris to be promoting the allegations against Trump, with not a single participant raising their hand.
The Trump campaign has denied the allegations against him, including Trump campaign spokesman Steven Cheung telling the NYT that Kellyâ€™s alleged White House recollections are â€œdebunked storiesâ€ and asserting the former White House chief of staff had â€œbeclownedâ€ himself.

title: â€˜You Canâ€™t Say You Werenâ€™t Warnedâ€™: CNNâ€™s Harry Enten Breaks Down â€˜Signsâ€™ Pointing To Trump Victory
content:
CNN senior data reporter Harry Enten on Wednesday outlined factors that point to former President Donald Trump defeating Vice President Kamala Harris in November.
Trump and Harris are currently locked in a tight race as the former president holds a narrow lead over the vice president in six of the top seven battleground states, according to the RealClearPolling averages. Enten, on â€œCNN News Central,â€ said that voter dissatisfaction with the countryâ€™s trajectory, President Joe Bidenâ€™s unpopularity and high Republican registration numbers are indicators favoring a Trump victory. (RELATED: Prominent Election Expert Suggests Pollsters â€˜Have No Ideaâ€™ If Theyâ€™re Accurately Measuring Trump Support)
WATCH:
â€œJust 28% of Americans, voters think the country is going in the right direction, is on the right track. And I want to put that into a historical perspective for you. Okay, whatâ€™s the average percentage of the public that thinks that the country is on the right track when the incumbent party loses? Itâ€™s 25%,â€ Enten said. â€œThat 25% looks an awful bit like that 28% up there. It doesnâ€™t look anything, anything like this 42% [average when the incumbent party won] doesnâ€™t look anything like this 28%.â€
â€œSo the bottom line is very few Americans think the country is on the right track at this particular point. It tracks much more with when the incumbent party loses than with [when] it wins. In fact, I went back through history, there isnâ€™t a single time in which 28% of the American public thinks the country is going on the right track in which the incumbent party actually won,â€ he added. They always lose when just 28% of the country believes that the country is on the right track.â€
Enten also noted that Bidenâ€™s low approval rating could historically signal a loss for Harris based on previous presidents with net negative approval ratings not being followed by successors from their own party.
â€œNow, we donâ€™t know if Kamala Harris is going to succeed Joe Biden, but we know back in 2008, George W. Bushâ€™s approval rating was down in the 20â€™s. Did a Republican succeed George W. Bush? No. How â€™bout in 1968? Lyndon Baines Johnson, his net approval rating was negative. Did a Democrat succeed Lyndon Baines Johnson? No,â€ the data reporter said. â€œHow â€™bout in â€™52 Harry S. Truman, his approval rating was in the 20â€™s, if not the upper teens.â€
â€œDid a Democrat succeed Harry S. Truman in â€™52? My memory, no â€¦ Dwight Eisenhower, a Republican, succeeded Harry S. Truman,â€ he continued. â€œSo the bottom line is for Kamala Harris to win, sheâ€™d have to break history, be a Democrat to succeed Joe Biden when Bidenâ€™s approval rating is way underwater at this point.â€
Moreover, Enten said Republicans have been gaining ground against Democrats in party registration in the battleground states, particularly noting Arizona, Nevada, North Carolina and Pennsylvania.
â€œSo Republicans are putting more Republicans in the electorate, the Democratic number versus the Republican number has shrunk. And so the bottom line is if Republicans win, come next week, Donald Trump wins comes next week, the signs all along will have been obvious,â€ he said. â€œWe would look at the right direction being very low, Joe Bidenâ€™s approval rating being very low and Republicans really registering numbers. You canâ€™t say you werenâ€™t warned.â€

title: â€˜Going Down?â€™: Top Democrats Reportedly Anxious About Harrisâ€™ Election Chances
content:
Top Democrats are worried about Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ chances Nov. 5 while most polls have the presidential race locked in a dead heat, according to Axios.
Less than two weeks to go, top Democrats are already discussing who is to blame for a loss to former President Donald Trump: the vice president or President Joe Biden for failing to drop out of the race earlier, Axios reported based on conversations with officials inside her campaign and top Biden administration officials. Democrats expressed concern to Axios that in her shortened campaign the vice president hasnâ€™t defined herself enough and has cast too many different arguments against Trump.
â€œShe is who she is,â€ one longtime Democratic strategist told the outlet. â€œLetâ€™s hope itâ€™s enough.â€
â€œGoing down?â€ a top Democratic official sent in a text to Axios.
The Harris campaign is worried about the vice presidentâ€™s chances in the states that make up the â€œblue wall,â€ especially in Michigan, where the Muslim community is prominent, three sources with knowledge of the campaignâ€™s strategy told NBC News. (RELATED: â€˜Weâ€™re Desperateâ€™: Socialists, Muslims Band Together To Deny Harris The White House)
As top Democrats worry the vice president hasnâ€™t done a good job making the case for why she should be president, many were impressed with a line she used during a CNN town hall Wednesday, Axios reported.
â€œJust imagine the Oval Office in three months â€¦ Itâ€™s either Donald Trump in there stewing â€” stewing! â€” over his enemies list, or me, working for you, checking off my to-do list,â€ Harris said.
â€œBetter late than never,â€ a top Democrat told Axios, with another adding, â€œitâ€™s good. Weâ€™re not dead yet.â€
During that same town hall, the vice president said she believed Trump was a fascist, citing comments his former chief of staff John Kelly made to The New York Times and the Atlantic. Earlier that day, Harris gave impromptu remarks on the articles in which Kelly claimed that Trump would rule like a fascist, said Hitler â€œdid some good thingsâ€ and wanted generals like the Nazi dictator.
The Trump campaign has denied both stories.
The Atlantic story also alleged that Trump disparaged a deceased veteran and her family. Former officials, the Trump campaign, the veteranâ€™s family and their lawyer all went on the record to deny the story.
â€œAll of this is further evidence for the American people of who Donald Trump really is,â€ Harris said about the stories. â€œThis is a window into who Donald Trump really is, from the people who know him best. From the people who worked with him side by side, in the Oval Office and in the Situation Room.
â€œIt is clear from John Kellyâ€™s words that Donald Trump is someone who, I quote, â€˜certainly falls into the general definition of fascist.â€™ Who vowed to be a dictator on day one and vowed to use the military as his personal militia to carry out his personal and political vendettas,â€ she continued.
In the final weeks of the campaign, Harrisâ€™ message has shifted to criticizing Trump and the threat he poses to the nation. Bidenâ€™s campaign message was similar and centered around calling Trump a threat to democracy. Before the president ended his bid for the White House, senior Democrats alongside some of Bidenâ€™s aides were doubting the â€œthreat to democracyâ€ slogan, Axios reported.
Harris is poised to make her closing argument for new leadership Tuesday at the spot Trump spoke at before the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, according to NBC News.

title: Tucker At Trump Rally: â€˜They Went Out Of Their Way To Humiliate You And Spit On You And The Graves Of Your Ancestorsâ€™
content:

He ripped Democrats who support tearing down statues and allowing illegal migrants to pour into the U.S., declaring that the majority of America will tolerate this no more.
