title: Not To Be Outdone By An Insult Comic, Biden Calls American Voters â€˜Garbageâ€™
content:
President Joe Biden referred to former President Donald Trumpâ€™s supporters as â€œgarbageâ€ Tuesday in a Zoom call with the organization Voto Latino following comments made at a Trump rally by a comedian.
The comments from the president were in response to those made by comic Tony Hinchcliffe on Sunday while speaking at a Trump rally in Madison Square Garden, where the comedian referred to Puerto Rico as a â€œfloating island of garbage.â€ Biden attempted to clarify the comments in an X post Tuesday night after receiving backlash, claiming he was referring to the â€œrhetoricâ€ put out by the comic and not Trump supporters.
â€œDonald Trump has no character. He doesnâ€™t give a damn about the Latino community. Heâ€™s failed a businessman. He only cares about the billionaire friends he had and accumulated wealth for those at the top,â€ Biden said in the video.
â€œAnd just the other day, a speaker at his rally called Puerto Rico a â€˜floating island of garbage.â€™ Well, let me tell you something â€¦ I donâ€™t know the Puerto Rican that I know â€” or a Puerto Rico, where Iâ€™m â€” in my home state of Delaware, theyâ€™re good, decent, honorable people. The only garbage I see floating out there is his supporters. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable, and itâ€™s un-American. Itâ€™s totally contrary to everything weâ€™ve done, everything weâ€™ve been.â€
Hereâ€™s the video: pic.twitter.com/7hNp3su8k2
â€” Gabe Gutierrez (@gabegutierrez) October 30, 2024
Biden addressed the backlash by condemning the rhetoric against Puerto Rico at Trumpâ€™s Madison Square Garden rally as hateful. He clarified that he believed the alleged divisive language toward Latinos contradicts American values.
â€œEarlier today I referred to the hateful rhetoric about Puerto Rico spewed by Trumpâ€™s supporter at his Madison Square Garden rally as garbage â€” which is the only word I can think of to describe it. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable. Thatâ€™s all I meant to say. The comments at that rally donâ€™t reflect who we are as a nation,â€ Biden wrote on X.
In a statement reported by journalist Gabe Gutierrez, the White House further emphasized that Biden was referring to the comedian Tony Hinchcliffe, who backs Trump and made disparaging remarks about Puerto Rico. (RELATED: Anti-Trump Journalist Claims Dem â€˜Outrageâ€™ Over Trump MSG Rally â€˜Missesâ€™ Point, Predicts Most â€˜Diverseâ€™ GOP Base Ever)
â€œThereâ€™s a lot going on. I donâ€™t know if you know this, but thereâ€™s literally a floating island of garbage in the middle of the ocean right now. I think itâ€™s called Puerto Rico,â€ Hinchcliffe said at the rally.
The White House initially released a transcript that showed Biden saying â€œsupportersâ€™,â€ with a plural possessive apostrophe. Later on, they updated the transcript to read â€œsupporterâ€™s,â€ implying that Biden wasnâ€™t referring to millions of Americans, but only Hinchcliffe himself. Many on social media, however, werenâ€™t buying it and accused the White House of incorrectly using an apostrophe.
The White House put a fake apostrophe in the transcript but the spoken word is clear. https://t.co/HIN6QulTjZ
â€” Miranda Devine (@mirandadevine) October 30, 2024
Morning Joe readâ€”didnâ€™t playâ€”Bidenâ€™s â€œgarbageâ€ comment to explain it. Another host cited the â€œapostropheâ€ as the culprit again. pic.twitter.com/MDDjLwJ7ZP
â€” Laura Ingraham (@IngrahamAngle) October 30, 2024
â€œThe only garbage I see floating out there is his supporters.â€ Thatâ€™s a direct quote. Thatâ€™s what Kamala Harrisâ€™s boss said. This is how Politico decided to report it:
Do @JonLemire @alexanderburns @politico have an ounce of integrity? Will they correct this obvious falsehood? pic.twitter.com/B1ktGVpLfz
â€” JD Vance (@JDVance) October 30, 2024
Former Daily Caller reporter and now-CNN host Kaitlan Collins on her show Tuesday night doubted the idea that Biden meant â€œsupporterâ€™sâ€ with an apostrophe.
â€œThe White House is trying to say that what President Biden was saying â€” theyâ€™re putting an apostrophe there in â€˜supporters,â€™ saying itâ€™s the singular, I guess referring to the comedian,â€ Collins said. â€œI mean, itâ€™s hard to really look at that when you can listen to it for yourself â€¦â€
Democratic Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro apparently criticized the attack as well on Collinsâ€™ show. â€œI would never insult the good people of Pennsylvania or any Americans even if they chose to support a candidate that I didnâ€™t support.â€
This story has been updated with additional context surrounding the â€œapostropheâ€ fight.

title: Virginia Asks Supreme Court To Let It Remove Noncitizens From Voter Rolls
content:
Virginia asked the Supreme Court Monday to block a lower court order to return over a thousand alleged noncitizens to the voter rolls.
Virginia Attorney General Jason Miyares vowed to file the emergency appeal Sunday after an appeals court upheld a ruling preventing officials from removing roughly 1,600 individuals who the state says â€œself-identifiedâ€ as noncitizens.
â€œThe injunction, which prohibits the application of a law that has been on the books since the Justice Department precleared it in 2006, will also irreparably injure Virginiaâ€™s sovereignty, confuse her voters, overload her election machinery and administrators, and likely lead noncitizens to think they are permitted to vote, a criminal offence that will cancel the franchise of eligible voters,â€ the state argued in its petition.
U.S. District Court Judge Patricia Giles, a Biden appointee, issued an order Friday blocking Virginiaâ€™s efforts to remove noncitizen voters within 90 days of the election. (RELATED: Biden-Appointed Judge Blocks Virginia Effort To Remove Non-Citizens From Voter Rolls)
The Department of Justice (DOJ) sued Virginia Oct. 12 over Gov. Glenn Youngkinâ€™s executive order to more frequently remove noncitizens.
ğŸš¨ BREAKING: Last night, Virginia filed an emergency stay in the US Supreme Court.
Americans citizens â€” and no one else â€” should determine American elections.
â€” Jason Miyares (@JasonMiyaresVA) October 28, 2024
â€œThe Department of Justice pulled this shameful, politically motivated stunt 25 days before Election Day, challenging a Virginia process signed into law 18 years ago by a Democrat governor and approved by the Department of Justice in 2006,â€ Miyares said in a statement Friday.
â€œMore concerning is the open practice by the Biden-Harris administration to weaponize the legal system against the enemies of so-called progress,â€ Miyares said. â€œThat is the definition of lawfare. To openly choose weaponization over good process and lawfare over integrity isnâ€™t democracy: itâ€™s bullying, pure and simple, and I always stand up to bullies.â€
A federal judge blocked Alabamaâ€™s efforts to remove noncitizens from the voter rolls earlier in October.

title: Bomb Threat Forces Swing State County GOP Headquarters To Close
content:
The Republican committee headquarters in Montgomery County, Pennsylvania, was forced to close its doors on Saturday after staff received a bomb threat by phone, according to a press release.
Pennsylvaniaâ€™s GOP stated that an â€œangryâ€ caller made a â€œprofanity-laced bomb threatâ€ to the Montgomery County office around 11:07 a.m. The state GOP noted that this incident isnâ€™t isolated, as the party has experienced an increase in violent threats since September.
â€œNothing will stop us from working to elect those who will put our country back on track,â€ Republican Party of Pennsylvania Chairman Lawrence Tabas wrote.
â€œAnd there should be unanimous agreement that political violence has no place in our elections, especially after an innocent Butler County husband and father lost his life to political violence,â€ Tabas added. â€œWe emphatically urge Pennsylvanians to voice their opinions by voting, not violence and intimidation.â€
In early September, an Erie County GOP staffer allegedly received death threats from a state resident, who threatened to kill the worker if they did not respond. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Horribleâ€™: Undecided Pennsylvania Voter Panel Unanimously Opposes Harris Calling Trump â€˜Fascistâ€™)
â€œI will KILL YOU IF YOU DONâ€™T ANSWER ME!â€ â€œGONNA F***ING FIND YOU AND SKIN YOU ALIVE AND USE YOUR SKIN FOR F***ING TOILET PAPER, YOU F***ING KKK**T!â€ the test message stated, according to the press release.
Later, on Oct. 10, protestors â€œforcibly enteredâ€ the Delaware County Republican headquarters, reportedly threatening to â€œkill staffâ€ and refusing to allow them to leave the building, according to the press release. During the incident, two female volunteers told authorities they felt threatened by the four protestors, the Mainline Times & Suburban reported.
â€œThis type of harassment â€” a descent into threats or intimidation â€” ought to have no no place in our community,â€ Republican Party officials told the outlet at the time. â€œWe condemn it in the strongest possible terms, and call on our friends across the aisle to do the same.â€
By Oct. 17, an unspecified number of GOP-affiliated individuals received an anonymous letter warning that if former President Donald Trump wins this November, their â€œpropertyâ€ and family â€œmay be impacted,â€ the press release reported.
â€œShould your candidate winâ€¦we know where you live, you are in the data base. In the dead of a cold winters night, this year, or next and beyond, there is no knowing what may happen. Your property, your family may be impactedâ€¦â€ the letter stated. â€œYou tread on me at your peril, motherf****r. We look forward to visiting in the future.â€
The stateâ€™s GOP noted local police departments, Democratic Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiroâ€™s Election Integrity Task Force and the FBI have been made aware of the threats.
Shapiroâ€™s office and the FBI did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: â€˜Shut The Hell Upâ€™: Charlamagne Melts Down Over Caller Saying Trump Isnâ€™t â€˜Naziâ€™
content:
Radio host Charlamagne Tha God on Thursday appeared to lose his temper at a Virginia caller named Mike who asserted former President Donald Trumpâ€™s record proves he is not a bigot.
Trumpâ€™s former White House chief of staff, John Kelly, told The New York Times and The Atlantic that the former president exhibited â€œfascistâ€ tendencies and allegedly praised Adolf Hitler, which the Trump campaign has denied. Mike, on â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ said Trumpâ€™s history of publicly associating with prominent black figures indicates heâ€™s not â€œracist,â€ but Charlamagne sharply disagreed, challenging Mikeâ€™s logic and trying to dismantle his argument. (RELATED: Harris Fails To Explain Flip-Flops, Says She Has No Regrets About Biden In First Interview)
LISTEN:
â€œNo disrespect to nobody, man. I know everybody in that radio station more than likely gonâ€™ vote Democrat, but itâ€™s just kind of funny, the rhetoric about Trump being a racist,â€ Mike said. â€œI mean, I do my Googles, man and I see this man having pictures with all kinds of famous black people that you guys are fans of, especially I see him standing next to Rosa Parks. I mean, for crying out loud people, how can this man be a Nazi, a Hitler? That shit is crazy. No disrespect.â€
â€œSo thatâ€™s all it takes? So if you take a picture with a gay person, does that make you gay?â€ Charlamagne asked, to which Mike answered, â€œNah.â€
The radio host then told the caller to â€œshut the hell upâ€ and asked, â€œWhat are you talking about?â€
â€œNo Nazi, no Hitler will ever take a picture with black people, man, will never do any kind of favors to black people,â€ Mike responded.
â€œThatâ€™s not true,â€ Charlamagne retorted. â€œSlave masters used to sleep with slaves. And what? Slave masters would have babies with slaves. And what?â€
Mike responded that weâ€™re beyond â€œslavery times.â€
â€œSo let me ask you a question, serious question â€¦ You think you donâ€™t encounter no racist white people everyday, you think just because they interact with you and they engage with you, you think that theyâ€™re not racist?â€ Charlamagne asked, with Mike answering, â€œNo.â€
The show then hung up on the caller, with Charlamagne saying, â€œI canâ€™t listen to that.â€
Trump currently holds narrow leads over Vice President Kamala Harris in all of the seven top swing states, according to RealClearPolling averages. The caller before Mike on â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ described Trump as â€œHitler Jr.â€ but told Charlamagne he still wouldnâ€™t be voting for Harris due to his distrust of Democrats.
â€œI donâ€™t trust the Democrats, bruh. As a black man in America, we done been lied to so long. Promises have never been kept,â€ he said. â€œIâ€™ma just keep it a buck. Iâ€™m not voting this year â€¦ I donâ€™t trust the Democrats, and I damn sure ainâ€™t voting for Hitler Jr. Whatever happens gonâ€™ happen.â€
â€œWell, if you not votinâ€™ and Hitler Jr. wins, then you know you gonâ€™ have to blame yourself,â€ Charlamagne retorted. â€œYou gonâ€™ have to take some of the blame.â€

content:

Emhoffâ€™s ex-girlfriend, who asked the Daily Mail to use the alias â€œJane,â€ confirmed allegations from three friends that Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ now-husband â€œslapped [her] so hard [she] spun aroundâ€ during a celebrity event in 2012.

The only thing I could think to do was slap him back. I slapped him on one side, and on the other cheek with the other hand.â€

Biden apparently wants to be a bigger part of Harrisâ€™ campaign, but her team is blowing him off, according to Axios. â€œHarrisâ€™ campaign keeps responding: â€˜Weâ€™ll get back to you,'â€ three people familiar with the situation told the outlet.

Her campaign is complaining about DeSantis and heâ€™s praising DeSantis,â€ Podhoretz said. â€œWhy, itâ€™s almost like she staged a coup against him and he is working against her from the sidelines!â€

title: New Poll Spells Major Trouble For Harris With Unlikely Demographic
content:
Former President Donald Trump is maintaining a small lead over Vice President Kamala Harris among an unlikely demographic as her campaign reportedly worries about her chances in key swing states, according to a new Arab News/YouGov poll obtained by Semafor.
In a new Arab News/YouGov poll, 45% of Arab American voters said they are more likely to vote for Trump, compared to 43% who said they will likely vote for Harris. More Arab Americans, 39%, think Trump will â€œsuccessfully resolve the Israel-Palestine conflict,â€ compared to Harris who has 33% of the communityâ€™s support on this question, the poll shows. Two weeks before the election, the Harris campaign is worried about the vice presidentâ€™s chances in the â€œblue wall,â€ such as Michigan, where the Muslim community is prominent, three sources with knowledge of the campaignâ€™s strategy told NBC News. (Stream Daily Callerâ€™s latest documentary â€˜Cleaning Up Kamalaâ€™ HERE)
â€œThere has been a thought that maybe Michigan or Wisconsin will fall off,â€ a senior Harris campaign official told NBC News, emphasizing that there are real concerns over her path to victory if Michigan goes for Trump while Wisconsin and Pennsylvania stay blue.
Of likely Arab American voters, 4% of respondents said they would cast their vote for third-party candidate Jill Stein and 6% said they were still undecided, according to the poll. Arab News/YouGov surveyed 500 Arab Americans nationally between Sept. 26 and Oct. 1 2024 and the poll has a margin of error of 5.93%.
ğŸ§µ President Trump took to Truth Social to voice concerns that Arab-Americans are disaffected with Kamala Harris.
The Daily Caller recently did a deep dive on dissatisfaction with Harris in Muslim communities in Michigan that touched on some of the same concerns. pic.twitter.com/QQS0X3zGwt
â€” Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) October 21, 2024
Muslim Americans in Michigan are making an effort to flip the state for Trump in protest of the Biden-Harris administrationâ€™s Middle East policy. One activist organization, Drive for 75, has calculated that if 75% of its community can turn out to the polls then the vice president has a 99.9% chance of losing, Rex Nazarko, who is heading up the effort, previously told the Daily Caller. (RELATED: â€˜Weâ€™re Desperateâ€™: Socialists, Muslims Band Together To Deny Harris The White House)
â€œWhat was a guarantee for [a Harris loss] to happen? We tried with different percentages and different turnouts, and with the 75% number, again, accounting only for the Muslim community, not other communities, not other allies, not other progressives. It essentially guaranteed a 99.9% likelihood of the vice president losing the election in Michigan, if 75% of [the community turned out],â€ Nazarko told the Caller, explaining that they ran numerous mathematical simulations to inform their strategy.
â€œWe ran that simulation 10,000 times, and almost every time that was the case. So thatâ€™s how we got the Drive for 75 call to action and idea,â€ he explained.
As a part of the effort to flip the state, Muslim activist organizations are pushing their community to vote for Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, or even Trump, they told the Daily Caller. Abandon Harris, one of those groups trying to spoil Harrisâ€™ election chances, threw its support behind Stein, who also has the backing of some socialist groups in the U.S. due to her anti-capitalist economic positioning.
â€œWe need to be clear about what our goals are, we are not in a position to win the White House. But we do have a real opportunity to win something historic. We could deny Kamala Harris the state of Michigan,â€ Kshama Sawant, a former Seattle City Council Member and self-described socialist, said to cheers at a recent rally for Stein.
A Harris campaign spokesperson denied NBC Newsâ€™ report that there were concerns over their ability to win Michigan.
â€œWe absolutely are competing to win Michigan,â€ Harris campaign spokeswoman Lauren Hitt told NBC News, pointing to the vice presidentâ€™s recent stops in the state. â€œWe think we will win Michigan.â€
The vice president has recently campaigned across key swing states including Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin alongside former Republican Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney.
Alongside Cheney, her father, former Vice President Dick Cheney previously endorsed Harris, though the endorsement might not have the positive effect the campaign is hoping to have, one Michigander told the Caller.
â€œHereâ€™s the new thing going around, people are saying that, â€˜hello, sheâ€™s been endorsed by Dick Cheney.â€™ That tells you everything you need to know about this woman: that her intentions are war,â€ Vice chair of the 12th Congressional District Republican Committee Stephanie Butler, who is married to a Muslim, told the Caller.
â€” Alex Pfeiffer (@__Pfeiffer) October 21, 2024
Trump took to TruthSocial Monday to give a message to Arab and Muslim American voters ahead of the election on Harrisâ€™ Middle East policy.
â€œArab Voters are very upset that Comrade Kamala Harris, the Worst Vice President in the History of the United States and a Low IQ individual, is campaigning with â€˜dumb as a rockâ€™ War Hawk, Liz Cheney, who, like her father, the man that pushed Bush to ridiculously go to War in the Middle East, also wants to go to War with every Muslim Country known to mankind,â€ Trump wrote.
â€œIf Kamala gets four more years, the Middle East will spend the next four decades going up in flames, and your kids will be going off to war, maybe even a Third World War, something that will never happen with President Donald J. Trump in charge. For our countryâ€™s sake, and for your kids, Vote Trump for PEACE!â€ the former president wrote.

title: DOJ Sends Muskâ€™s PAC Warning Over $1 Million Voter Lottery
content:
The Justice Department(DOJ) reportedly notified Elon Muskâ€™s America PAC that its $1 million sweepstakes for registered voters in key swing states might contravene federal regulations, according to The Wall Street Journal.
These payments might breach laws against compensating people to register or vote in elections involving federal candidates, according to the DOJâ€™s letter, WSJ reported. Muskâ€™s political action committee has been actively promoting the chance to win $1 million for registered voters in Pennsylvania and six other pivotal states who pledge their support for free speech and gun rights by signing a petition.
The America Pac declined to comment but a spokesperson earlier claimed their cash awards were entirely legal, suggesting that the outcry from media only aids their cause. â€œThe PAC is confident in the legality of this initiative and the predictable media meltdown is only helping America PACâ€™s efforts to support President Trump,â€ a representative said earlier this week, WSJ stated.
The Justice Department has written to Elon Muskâ€™s America PAC cautioning him that giving cash payments to voters who sign a petition might violate federal law, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/4AcFbc6jic
â€” WSJ Politics (@WSJPolitics) October 23, 2024
Three voters from Pennsylvania and one in North Carolina have secured million-dollar rewards, with daily drawings set to continue through Election Day, targeting both new and existing registrants, WSJ reported. Musk stated that the million-dollar rewards from his PAC come without conditions, except for the expectation that winners advocate for his petition.
The sweepstakes aims to boost voter registrations in battleground areas as he fervently supports former President Donald Trumpâ€™s re-election bid. Musk announced at a Pennsylvania rally for Trumpâ€™s campaign Saturday evening that he will give $1 million daily to one individual. (RELATED: British Group With Ties To Harris, Democrats Aims To â€˜Kill Muskâ€™s Twitter,â€™ Documents Say)
UCLA law professor Rick Hasen previously raised a question about whether a constitutional amendment is necessary to curb the campaign influence of ultra-wealthy individuals like Musk. Hasen pointed out on MSNBC that under current law, efforts to curb election spending by the ultra-rich have been deemed unconstitutional, affirming the legality of Muskâ€™s activities with his super PAC and other ventures.
The Justice Department and America PAC did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Colorado Secretary Of State Website Posts â€˜Partial Passwordsâ€™ To Voting Systems, Assures Public â€˜No Security Breachâ€™
content:
Democratic Colorado Secretary of State Jena Griswold admitted Tuesday that â€œpartial passwordsâ€ to state voting systems were posted on her officeâ€™s website for months before being taken down and appeared to downplay election integrity concerns.
A file available for download was posted on the Secretary of State website, the Colorado Republican Party said, citing an affidavit. This file allegedly contained a list BIOS passwords for more than 700 voting components in 63 out of Coloradoâ€™s 64 counties. An unidentified official quietly removed the file on Oct. 24, the party claimed.
Griswold denied the allegations of the Colorado GOP in a Tuesday interview with 9News, saying that the leaked passwords were only â€œpartial passwords.â€
â€œThis is not a security threat,â€ Griswold said. When asked how many counties were impacted, Griswold would not answer.
â€œAt this point, Kyle, we have staff in the field looking at the situation, but we will disclose when we are out of the field,â€ Griswold said. â€œTo be clear, we do not see this as a full security threat to the state.â€
Griswold did admit that the passwords were published on her officeâ€™s website and â€œwere up for several monthsâ€ before being taken down. She also claimed some of the passwords were not â€œactive.â€ The secretary maintained that an investigation was underway with federal assistance. (RELATED: Pro-Palestine Messages Reportedly Found On Devices At Ballot Box Fires)
Colorado GOP Chairman Dave Williams sent a letter to Griswoldâ€™s office on Oct. 29 demanding immediate action. He also contradicted Griswoldâ€™s characterization that the leaks were not a security threat.
â€œAs you are well aware, a BIOS password could allow a knowledgeable user to not only gain total control over any system accessed either physically or remotely, including the ability to manipulate those systems and results, but it would allow that user to remove any trace that she was ever there (overwriting even fundamental system logs necessary during a subsequent audit to show whether illicit access or activity had ever occurred),â€ Williams wrote.
He also requested verification that the passwords in question had been replaced.
Heidi Ganahl, former Republican gubernatorial candidate in Colorado, pointed out that Griswoldâ€™s office has previously classified the leakage of BIOS passwords as a â€œserious breach.â€
If Mesa in 2021 was a â€œserious breach,â€ NOT during an election, what is 600+ DURING an election? (1/3)@JenaGriswold said â€œThe public disclosure of the BIOS passwords for one or more components of Mesa Countyâ€™s voting system alone constitutes a serious breachâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/SdyUyY82mm
â€” Heidi Ganahl (@heidiganahl) October 29, 2024
â€œThe public disclosure of BIOS passwords for one or more components of Mesa Countyâ€™s voting system alone constitutes a serious breach of voting system security protocols, as well as a violation of Election Rule 20.6.1,â€ Griswoldâ€™s office said in a 2021 press release.
Tina Peters, a former election clerk from Mesa County, was sentenced to prison earlier this month for allowing unauthorized access to voting equipment, according to The Associated Press (AP). In that case, Griswold touted the case as representing Coloradoâ€™s approach to election security.
â€œColoradoâ€™s elections are the nationâ€™s gold standard. I am proud of how we have responded to the first insider elections breach in the nation and look forward to another secure and successful election in November,â€ Griswold said in a statement following the sentencing.
The Daily Caller has reached out to Griswoldâ€™s office and the Colorado Republican Party for comment.

title: NEW WSJ POLL: TRUMP TAKES LEAD NATIONALLY
content:
Former President Donald Trump has taken a narrow lead over Vice President Kamala Harris with less than two weeks until election day, according to a Wall Street Journal poll published Thursday.
Trump has pulled out in front with a 47-45 lead, a change from the Journalâ€™s polling in August, which had Kamala ahead by two percentage points. The two percentage points are within the pollâ€™s margin of error.
Harrisâ€™s favorability and job performance numbers have dropped since August while Trumpâ€™s job performance numbers has risen. In August, half of voters viewed her favorably. Now, as of late October, 45 percent view her favorably compared to 53 who view her unfavorably, according to the poll.
Harris is also seeing her worst job performance ratings as vice president since WSJ started asking voters about her performance. Fifty-four percent of voters disapprove of her performance compared to 42 percent who approve.
Exclusive: Trump has taken a narrow lead against Harris in the final weeks of the presidential race https://t.co/fUBlHlSvDb
â€” The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) October 24, 2024
Ad blitzes and â€œthe performance of the candidatesâ€ have contributed to the shift, the outlet reported.
â€œVoters are finally getting to know her,â€ Republican pollster David Lee, who ran the poll with Democrat Michael Bocian, told the WSJ. (RELATED: Wall Street Billionaires Are Starting To Bet On A Trump Win)
â€œThe definitional period is coming to an end, and more people are unhappy with what they have learned about her than what they know about President Trump,â€ Lee said.
Issues that voters appear to trust Trump over Harris on include the economy and immigration. Voters approve of Trump over Harris on the economy by 12 points compared to 8 in August, according to the poll. On immigration, they trust him by 15 points, a leap from the 7-point lead he had over Harris in August.
The Journalâ€™s poll results match other recent polls. While Real Clear Politicsâ€™ (RCP) national polling average still has Harris ahead by a hair â€“ 0.2 percent â€“ the four most recent polls all have Trump ahead by at least a two percent margin.
CNBC and Forbes/HarrisX, which polled likely voters as opposed to the registered voters that CNBC and WSJ polled, both have Trump ahead by two percent nationally.
Rasmussenâ€™s Wednesday poll has Trump up by three percent.
While RCPâ€™s average has Trump slightly behind nationally, heâ€™s ahead in every key battleground. Overall in the swing states heâ€™s up 0.9 percent. In Georgia heâ€™s ahead by 2.2 points. In Wisconsin and Michigan heâ€™s edging Harris by 0.2 percent.
Trump is also dominating in the betting markets. He has a 59 percent chance of winning versus Harrisâ€™ 40.1 percent chance, according to the RCP betting average.
Polymarket, the worldâ€™s largest prediction market, has Trumpâ€™s odds at 61.1 percent.
The shift is a far cry from early August, when Harris jumped out to a significant lead over Trump by most indicators. Harrisâ€™ current 0.2 percent lead in the RCP average is her lowest leading margin since she jumped ahead of Trump on Aug. 5.

title: Scott Jennings Doesnâ€™t Buy It When CNN Panelist Spins Biden Calling Trump Supporters â€˜Garbageâ€™
content:
Republican strategist Scott Jennings called out film executive Franklin Leonard Tuesday night after Leonard attempted to explain President Joe Bidenâ€™s comments characterizing supporters of former President Donald Trump as â€œgarbage.â€
Biden labeled the former presidentâ€™s supporters during a virtual campaign event Tuesday in response to a joke stand-up comedian Tony Hinchcliffe told during Trumpâ€™s rally at Madison Square Garden Sunday. Leonard cited Bidenâ€™s history of stuttering and claimed it was â€œvery obviousâ€ that Biden wasnâ€™t stereotyping all of Trumpâ€™s supporters during an episode of â€œCNN NewsNight,â€ prompting Jennings to respond. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Helpful If Youâ€™ll Answer The Questionâ€™: Harris Faulkner Chides Dem Guest For Spinning When Asked About Kamala Harris Comparing Trump To Hitler)
WATCH:
â€œLet me just accept the most charitable framing of this, which you just gave me,â€ Jennings responded. â€œWhy is he sitting in front of a laptop at the exact same moment Kamala Harris is out on his backyard trying to give the closing argument to her campaign? What in the world is he doing?â€
â€œI donâ€™t accept your framing of it, personally, because I actually do believe he, Harris, the Democratic Party and most of their campaign do believe that half the country is garbage,â€ Jennings continued.
Bidenâ€™s comments came as Vice President Kamala Harris has escalated attacks on Trump in the closing weeks of the presidential campaign, devoting a major speech Tuesday to attacking the former president as a threat to democracy and portraying him as â€œunstableâ€ days after she labeled the former president a â€œfascistâ€ during an Oct. 23 town hall on CNN.
â€œWell, let me tell you something â€¦ I donâ€™t know the Puerto Rican that I know â€” or a Puerto Rico, where Iâ€™m â€” in my home state of Delaware, theyâ€™re good, decent, honorable people,â€ Biden said. â€œThe only garbage I see floating out there is his supporters.â€
CNN banned conservative commentator Ryan Girdusky after he jokingly referenced an Israeli operation that targeted the radical Islamic terrorist group Hezbollah after former MSNBC host Mehdi Hasan defended describing Trump supporters as Nazis during a fiery exchange.
â€œTheyâ€™ve also said people who go to Trump rallies are Nazis and so itâ€™s pretty apparent the disdain with which they hold half of the country in,â€ Jennings concluded.

title: â€˜Trump Is The Only Candidateâ€™: Hundreds Of Former Nat Sec Officials Endorse Trump, Say Harris Dismantled Border
content:
More than 200 retired Department of Homeland Security (DHS) officials signed onto an open letter endorsing former President Donald Trump, arguing heâ€™s the only candidate who will enforce border security.
The Biden-Harris administration enacted policies that â€œsystematically dismantledâ€ a border enforcement apparatus that prevented crime at the U.S.-Mexico border and across the country, according to numerous retired Border Patrol, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and other DHS officials who have spent a career in the field. Signatories to the letter included retired Border Patrol chief Rodney Scott and former ICE chief Tom Homan, among many others. (RELATED: â€˜Something Has To Be Doneâ€™: Trump Pledges Compensation Fund For Victims Of Migrant Crime)
These border enforcement professionals laid out their case as to why they believe the border crisis got so incredibly bad during the current administration, and how things were different in the previous administration.
â€œPresident Trump respected the experience of career border security professionals and listened to our advice,â€ the letter stated. â€œWhen border security experts explained to President Trump how illegal immigration empowers the cartels to control who and what enters our home, he listened and acted.â€
â€œThe Trump administration supported policies and programs that reduced illegal immigration, instilled integrity into our legal immigration system and ensured that the U.S. government was doing all we could to control who and what entered our homeland. The borders of the U.S. were never more secure than they were during the Trump administration,â€ the letter continues.
Upon entering office, the Biden-Harris administration undertook 296 executive actions on immigration, with 89 of those orders specifically reversing or beginning the process of undoing Trumpâ€™s immigration policies. The administration went on to undo a number of major Trump initiatives concerning border security, such as ending border wall construction and shutting down the Remain in Mexico program.
What followed was a historic flow of illegal immigration through the U.S.-Mexico border. The number of illegal border crossings in fiscal year 2024 were the second worst in U.S. history â€” only surpassed by fiscal year 2023, according to data tracked by Customs and Border Protection (CBP).
Scott, who led Border Patrol from February 2020 to August 2021, previously told the Daily Caller News Foundation that the Biden administration tightly cracked down on him and his colleagues from speaking out about the border crisis.
Since taking over the re-election mantle from President Joe Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris has attempted to rebrand herself as more of a border hawk, with her campaign boasting ads that feature the border wall and a pledge to hire more Border Patrol agents if she wins in November.
Trumpâ€™s support from border security professionals isnâ€™t limited to those who have since retired from service. Earlier in October, the Border Patrol union formally endorsed the Republican candidate, with the president of the National Border Patrol Council saying that a victory for Harris would mean â€œevery city, every community in this great country, is going to go to hell.â€
The letter brought forward by the retired border professionals echoed similar sentiments.
[U]nder VP Harrisâ€™ watch, idealist political appointees with zero border security experience were empowered to implement disastrous and deadly border security policy for the United States,â€ the letter states. â€œThe devastating results have handed complete control of our border to the cartels, provided them with astronomical record profits, ballooned legal immigration backlogs, and have left millions of illegal aliens in the country.â€
â€œAssuming you care about border security as much as we do, the choice is clear. President Trump is the only candidate that we can trust to secure our nationâ€™s borders,â€ the letter concluded.
Neither the Trump campaign nor the Harris campaign immediately responded to a request for comment from the DCNF.

title: New York Voter Delivers Two-Word Response When MSNBC Asks If â€˜Threat To Democracyâ€™ Attack On Trump Resonates
content:
A voter in New York needed only two words Monday when an MSNBC reporter asked if Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ attacks on former President Donald Trump as a â€œthreat to democracyâ€ resonated with him.
Harris and her running mate, Democratic Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, have escalated attacks on former President Donald Trump, with Harris labeling him a â€œfascistâ€ during a CNN town hall and Walz comparing Trumpâ€™s Sunday rally at Madison Square Garden to a 1939 rally at the iconic venue held by the Nazi-sympathetic German American Bund. The voter took a few seconds to think before answering the unidentified MSNBC reporterâ€™s question. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Helpful If Youâ€™ll Answer The Questionâ€™: Harris Faulkner Chides Dem Guest For Spinning When Asked About Kamala Harris Comparing Trump To Hitler)
â€œHow does that message resonate with you?â€ the reporter asked.
WATCH:
â€œIt doesnâ€™t,â€ the voter responded.
Harris trails Trump by 0.1% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 11 to 26, with the former president maintaining that lead when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.
â€œWhy not?â€ the MSNBC reporter asked.
â€œBecause it feels political to me, it feels like a line that is being used,â€ the voter explained.
Inflation, the cost of living and the economy were viewed as either a top issue or â€œvery importantâ€ by over 80% of respondents to a CNBC poll conducted Oct. 15-19 that showed Trump leading Harris by 2%.
Republicans in the past have criticized Democrats over their portrayal of Trump as a â€œthreatâ€ to democracy, citing previous assassination attempts during the 2024 campaign.
A Secret Service agent thwarted a suspected assassination attempt on Trump in September by firing shots at Ryan Wesley Routh, who was allegedly lurking near Trump International Golf Club. The former president was shot in the right ear while giving a speech at a July 13 campaign rally in Pennsylvania, where a rally attendee was killed and two others wounded.

title: â€˜We Had A Bad Experienceâ€™: Chinese Officials Losing Sleep Over Thought Of Dealing With Second Trump Term
content:
Chinese Communist Party (CCP) officials quietly believe that a second Donald Trump presidency would be more dangerous to them than a Kamala Harris administration, The Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.
The Biden-Harris administrationâ€™s relationship with Beijing has been marred with tensions in recent years over diplomatic, economic and national security disputes. But Chinese officials would seemingly still rather have Harris win in November over Trump because they worry that the former president will open up another trade war against China, officials told the WSJ. (RELATED: Biden Gets Ready To Exit Political Stage As Global Fires Rage â€” Novemberâ€™s Victor Will Have To Put Them Out)
â€œChinese officials and scholars, in private conversations over many months, are largely exceptionally wary of a Trump victory,â€ Richard McGregor, China expert at the Lowy Institute in Sydney, told the WSJ.
Those worries are largely kept quiet. Publicly, Chinese officials maintain a stance of neutrality toward the U.S. elections. Chinese President Xi Jinping wrote in a letter last week that China had always handled relations with the U.S. with â€œmutual respectâ€ and said that Beijing â€œis willing to work with the United States as partners and friends.â€
â€œThe presidential elections are the United Statesâ€™ own affairs,â€ a spokesman from the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. told the Daily Caller News Foundation. â€œWe hope that whoever gets elected will be committed to growing sound and stable China-U.S. ties.â€
Beijing wants whoever the next president is to take a predictable stance toward relations and dial back the U.S.â€™ tough-on-China stance. Privately, officials felt that standard was better reflected in President Joe Biden over Trump and thought his reelection would be better for China, according to the WSJ.
After Biden dropped out of the race in July, Beijing felt the same about Harris, officials told the WSJ.
â€œUnder Trump, we had a bad experience,â€ senior CCP diplomat Liu Jianchao bemoaned during a closed-door session with U.S. think tanks earlier in the year.
The concerns of a second Trump term among Chinese officials stem from fears he will launch a second trade war against China, as he did in his first term, according to the WSJ.
Trump issued a sweeping set of tariffs against China during his first term â€” adding a tax to imports coming in from the country â€” in a bid to encourage domestic U.S. investment and compel China to buy more American goods.
Xi and those and his orbit became exhausted in trying to maneuver the trade war and Trumpâ€™s demands, according to the WSJ. Trump has weighed the idea in his second term to issue a 60% tariff against incoming Chinese goods, which economists at UBS have predicted could mark a 2.5% blow to Chinaâ€™s GDP growth over a year-long period.
Trump has also recently weighed the idea of using the threat of tariffs to deter China from invading Taiwan, even musing that he would completely halt trade relations if the island is taken by force, which has been received extremely poorly in Beijing.
â€œI would say: If you go into Taiwan, Iâ€™m sorry to do this, Iâ€™m going to tax youâ€â€”meaning impose tariffsâ€”â€œat 150% to 200%,â€ Trump told the WSJ in an interview on Thursday.
The Trump and Harris campaigns did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: Kari Lake Receives Good News In Her Bid To Add GOP Seat To Senate: POLL
content:
A Tuesday Data Orbital poll showed Arizona Senate Republican candidate Kari Lake pulling ahead of Democratic Rep. Ruben Gallego, breaking with recent data showing Lake trailing by a significant margin.
The Data Orbital survey, which consisted of responses from 550 likely voters and had a margin of error of 4.26%, found Lake receiving 45.2% support while Gallego received 44.5%, potentially representing a huge shift in the swing state race that has seen the Democratic candidate maintain a steady lead. However, the poll result could also be an outlier, with a Tuesday CNN survey of 781 likely voters finding Lake trailing by roughly 8%, and RealClear Polling (RCP) showing Gallego leading by 4% on average. (RELATED: Ted Cruz Pulls In Front Of Dem Challenger In Competitive Senate Race: POLL)
Lake has consistently underperformed former President Donald Trump, with Trump leading Vice President Kamala Harris by an average of 2.5% in the Grand Canyon State, according to RCP. The Democrats have spent $88.2 million on advertising for the Senate race since Labor Day, compared to just $29.7 million for Republicans, Politico reported on Oct. 18.
.@KariLake confronts Democrat opponent on the border
LAKE: â€œ Iâ€™m not working together with you, Iâ€™m going to beat you.â€ pic.twitter.com/wMbC7iGF4O
â€” Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) October 6, 2023
Lakeâ€™s platform emphasizes border security, fresh water access, energy independence and reducing inflation, among a variety of other policy initiatives.
Immigration has been a hot-button issue in the Arizona senate rate, with Gallego adopting a more centrist stance on the matter since his campaign began. In August 2023, the Democratic congressman voiced support for Title 42, a Trump-era public health order that expelled certain migrants, marking a major shift from 2015 when he introduced legislation that would eliminate the term â€œillegal alienâ€ from federal law.
The Democratic congressman has tried to distance himself from the Biden-Harris administration on the immigration issue, remarking in August that the White House hasnâ€™t done enough in support of border security.
â€œI think thereâ€™s a lot of Democrats that donâ€™t understand you can be for border security and for immigration reform,â€ Gallego told Axios.
Another key issue in the Arizona senate race has been abortion, particularly after the Arizona Supreme Court on April 9 permitted an 1864 law to be enforced that effectively banned abortion except when the life of the mother is in danger. When Gallego stated that Lake was â€œincredibly thrilledâ€ to ban abortion, Lake responded by noting the Democratic congressman had left his wife when she was nine months pregnant.
A report released by the Washington Free Beacon on Oct. 17 found that Gallego not only filed for divorce from his wife when she was â€œlikely to give birth any day,â€ but also wanted her to pay his attorneyâ€™s fees.
The Gallego and Lake campaigns did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

title: Pro-Palestine Messages Reportedly Found On Devices At Ballot Box Fires
content:
Devices recovered at two ballot box fires in the Pacific Northwest reportedly both contained pro-Palestinian messaging, according to The New York Times.
The words â€œFree Gaza,â€ were emblazoned on the devices that presumably caused the fires Monday in Portland, Oregon, and Vancouver, Washington, an anonymous source within the Portland Police Department (PPD) told The New York Times. The Portland Police Department (PPD) confirmed that the incidents are connected, but have yet to determine the motive. (RELATED: Dem Govâ€™s Nonprofit Pours Million Into Abortion Ballot Initiatives Across Multiple States)
â€œThere was enough evidence collected at all three scenes that lead us to believe that all three incidents are connected, and we cannot get into more detail,â€ Mike Benner, spokesman for the Portland Police Bureau, said on Monday according to The New York Times.
There was a third device that did not explode at another ballot box in Vancouver, according to The New York Times. All three devices were sent to the terrorist explosive device analytical center in Huntsville, Alabama, another PPD source told The New York Times.
After the October 7th attacks by Hamas against Israel, protests erupted in the United States demanding a ceasefire in the region and humanitarian support for people in Gaza. Some of the protests resulted in violence.
Press Release: UPDATE: PPB Releases Photos of Suspect Vehicle in Ballot Box Incident (Photo)
Link: https://t.co/r71JHZWpKE pic.twitter.com/giSXMINLq6â€” Portland Police (@PortlandPolice) October 28, 2024
In Portland, most of the ballots were undamaged due to the on-board fire suppression system, according to The New York Times. In Vancouver, hundreds of ballots were destroyed in the blaze.
While Washington and Oregon are not considered competitive states in the presidential election, Portland is electing a new mayor and a congressional race between Democrat Marie Perez and Republican Joe Kent in southwest Washington is extremely competitive, according to FiveThirtyEight polling averages.
Last election, Perez beat Kent by only 3,000 votes, according to The New York Times in August.
People who brought their ballot to the box were asked to request replacements, according to The New York Times. Clark County, which contains Vancouver in its boundaries, will place observers at 22 ballot boxes for 24 hours a day for protection.
Benner told the Daily Caller News Foundation that the device in Portland was recovered for forensic analysis and will be â€œexamined for any unique writings or markings.â€
The Vancouver PD did not immediately respond to the DCNFâ€™s request for comment.

title: â€˜Youâ€™ve Lied To Usâ€™: Chris Sununu Blasts Kamala Harris For â€˜Absolutely Condescendingâ€™ Campaign
content:
Republican Gov. Chris Sununu of New Hampshire accused Vice President Kamala Harris of lying to the American people for three and a half years about the economy as part of an â€œabsolutely condescendingâ€ campaign Tuesday.
The Biden-Harris administration has been heavily criticized for sky-high inflation that has led prices to rise by over 20%, with the consumer price index (CPI) reaching a recent high of 9% in June 2022. Sununu said to host Kate Bolduan on â€œCNN News Centralâ€ that Harrisâ€™ â€œcondescendingâ€ campaign was pushing voters to former President Donald Trump. (RELATED: â€˜She Shouldâ€™ve Been Thereâ€™: CNN Guest Says Kamala Harris â€˜Blew Itâ€™ By Skipping Al Smith Dinner)
â€œPeople are tired of wokeism. Theyâ€™re tired of being told that Biden and â€˜Bidenomicsâ€™ work,â€ Sununu said. â€œTheyâ€™re tired of these lies out of Washington that in these ads and all this talk that basically says, hey, your lived experience isnâ€™t real, donâ€™t worry, you havenâ€™t trouble paying the bills? No, no, we told you â€˜Bidenomicsâ€™ worked for you.â€
WATCH:
â€œItâ€™s absolutely condescending for the Harris campaign to keep pushing that kind of message. And thatâ€™s exactly why youâ€™re seeing those independents that you guys were just talking about. Thatâ€™s why youâ€™re seeing that swing,â€ Sununu continued. â€œItâ€™s not, but just youâ€™re too liberal, itâ€™s that youâ€˜ve lied to us for three-and-a-half years, youâ€™ve gaslighted us telling us that our lived experiences arenâ€™t real.â€
Bidenâ€™s approval rating on the economy was only 39.8% in the RealClearPolling average, while only 36% gave him good marks on inflation and only 34.8% approved of his handling of immigration, all of which have been issues emphasized by former President Donald Trump in the campaign.
â€œSo again, with all due respect to those two, they clearly have some personality issues with the former president. Donâ€™t blame them for that,â€ Sununu said regarding former Republican Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming and former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows. â€œA lot of people do, get in line, take a ticket on that one. But at the end of the day, I think this is where the election is going to go in the next two weeks.â€
Trump trails Harris by 1.1% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 8 to 22, with the gap decreasing to 1.0% when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.

title: Army Releases Heavily Redacted Report On Arlington Cemetery Altercation
content:
The Department of Defense (DOD) and Army released a report Friday disclosing the details of an altercation that occurred during former President Donald Trumpâ€™s August visit to Arlington National Cemetery.
Trump honored the 13 American service members killed during President Joe Bidenâ€™s August 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal on the three-year anniversary of the incident at a ceremony that later became controversial when reports surfaced that a physical altercation had occurred between a campaign official and an Arlington National Cemetery staffer over photo restrictions. The agency released the report in response to a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request from American Oversight but details a multitude of exemptions to the request including laws protecting inter- and intra-agency communications and records pertaining to an ongoing investigation, leaving the report heavily redacted.
The report labeled the event a â€œsimple assaultâ€ and said an action occurred with â€œboth of [redacted] hands while attempting to move pastâ€ but that no medical attention was necessary following the incident. The documents contain a sworn affidavit taken at the time of the altercation but is entirely redacted, including the name of who gave the statement.
The individual involved chose not to press charges following the incident, the report says.
The incident occurred after a cemetery staff member attempted to enforce a rule prohibiting political activity and â€œwas abruptly pushed asideâ€ by a Trump campaign official, according to NPR.
â€œParticipants in the August 26th ceremony and the subsequent Section 60 visit were made aware of federal laws, Army regulations and DoD policies, which clearly prohibit political activities on cemetery grounds,â€ the Army said in a statement after the incident, according to NPR. â€œAn ANC employee who attempted to ensure adherence to these rules was abruptly pushed aside. Consistent with the decorum expected at ANC, this employee acted with professionalism and avoided further disruption. The incident was reported to the JBM-HH police department, but the employee subsequently decided not to press charges. Therefore, the Army considers this matter closed.â€
Vice President Kamala Harris criticized Trump over the event, stating that the former president did not honor service members â€” a claim which several Gold Star families quickly rebuked by placing blame instead on Harris for her apparent lack of acknowledgment of the incident that killed the soldiers. The families requested Trump attend the event and take photos with them, Trump stated in a Truth Social post, and the families later confirmed to the Daily Caller. (EXCLUSIVE: Army Hit With Lawsuit After Stonewalling Inquiries Into West Pointâ€™s Removal Of Iconic Mission Statement)
The Army and DOD did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Gun Range Organizer Says Reporter Got Shot Because He And Kunce â€˜Didnâ€™t Listenâ€™ To Safety Advice, Messages Show
content:
The man who set up the gun range for Democratic Missouri Senate candidate Lucas Kunceâ€™s event, where a bullet ricocheted off a target and struck a reporter, appeared to claim that Kunce and the reporter ignored safety advice, according to messages in a private Facebook group reviewed by the Daily Caller.
Chad Everett Downs, the man who claims to have set up the gun range and who has told reporters he lives across the street from the range, commented on a story about the incident in a Facebook group. He said he was there and that Kunce and the reporter did not listen when they were told where they should stand while shooting. Downs, who may not be allowed to own a firearm due to felony charges, then said that it was perfectly normal to get hit with fragments while shooting steel.
Missouri court records show that Downs was charged with 17 counts of felony perjury in August and has been issued a criminal summons and waived his preliminary hearing, according to the Kansas City Star. â€œHis ex-wife in a court filing earlier this month alleged the man owns or has access to guns in violation of his bond conditions,â€ the outlet states.
After a user asked if Downs was the person in a picture with Cunce and a KSHB reporter, Downs replied by saying, â€œYeah. Those dudes were told where to stand. They didnâ€™t listen.â€ Downs said when you shoot steel, â€œyou always get frag. Iâ€™ve been hit probably 250 times.â€
He then started arguing with another member of the Facebook group, saying: â€œso behind the firing line is bad?? Yeah your training sounds pretty intense. Youâ€™re basically a Navy Seal.â€ (RELATED: â€˜Couldâ€™ve Killed Someoneâ€™: Conservatives Blast Dem Candidate For Gun Photo-Op That Injured Reporter With Shrapnel)
â€œI just gave them a place to shoot. Told them what I thought, then they did what they wanted to,â€ Downs said. â€œDo you know someone whoâ€™s been killed by a small fragment??â€ (RELATED: Stray Bullet Strikes TV Reporter At Democratic Senate Campaign Event)
â€œ[Y]our range your responsibility. That is the lamest cop out lâ€™ve ever seen in my life,â€ one of the Facebook users replied to him.
READ MORE HERE:
DAILY CALLER OBTAINED â€” Coâ€¦ by Henry Rodgers
Kunceâ€™s campaign has said, â€œSafety is important to us, which is why the range was set up and run by a NRA Training Counselor.â€ Downsâ€™ Facebook account says he is a â€œNRA training counselor.â€
The Daily Caller contacted Downs to try to interview him about the incident and his comments, to which he said he would give an interview â€œfor $5,000 if you want to know what really happened.â€
Downs also told the Caller: â€œI made a video of the range with exact distances and where everyone was standing.â€ He would not share the video with the Caller, however.

title: California Dems In Tight House Races Back Tough-On-Crime Ballot Measure That Newsom Opposes
content:
California Democrats in tight House races are backing a crime ballot measure despite Democratic California Gov. Gavin Newsom strongly opposing the initiative, according to the Los Angeles Times Thursday.
Although Newsom fiercely opposes Proposition 36, which increases penalties for retail and drug crimes, many Democrats in tight House races have thrown their support behind the measure, according to the L.A. Times. Proposition 36 is popular with the majority of Californians, with 73% of voters supporting the measure, according to a Public Policy Institute of California (PPIC) poll conducted Oct. 7 to Oct. 15.
Newsom said the measure would cause â€œmass incarcerationâ€ and that it was an â€œinsult,â€ according to the San Francisco Chronicle. However, he also said that he does not have the â€œbandwidthâ€ to actively campaign against the measure, according to the Sacramento Bee Sept. 20.
â€œI would think that a Republican opponent would love it if a Democratic candidate opposed Prop. 36 because it would make it very easy for them to paint them as soft on crime,â€ Jared Sichel, political strategist for Republican, conservative and independent candidates in Orange County told the Los Angeles Times. â€œIf you are a Democrat that is opposed to Prop. 36, that will hurt you in November.â€ (RELATED: California Keeps Driving Up Gas Prices With â€˜Layers And Layersâ€™ Of Green Rules And Regs)
Democratic House candidates who support Proposition 36 include Adam Gray in the 13th Congressional district, Will Rollins in the 41st district, Derek Tran in the 46th district, Rudy Salas in the 22nd district and Joe Kerr in the 40th district, according to the L.A. Times. Most of the races take place in districts with a â€œhealthy mix of Republicans and Democrats,â€ Sichel told the L.A. Times.
For example, the 13th district race between Gray and Republican Scott Baugh is within 3 points, according to a WPA Intelligence poll published Oct. 20. The race for the 22nd district between Salas and Republican incumbent David Valadao is currently tied, according to a September Emerson College poll.
Proposition 36 comes in the wake of discontent with the results of the 2014 Proposition 47, which downgraded the penalties for drug possession and theft under $950 from felonies to misdemeanors. The incarceration rate fell 8% the two years after Proposition 47 passed, according to a September PPIC study.
Crime has been a persistent issue in the state, with overall crime up 1.7% in 2023 and up 15.4% since 2019, according to the PPIC. Out of all property crimes reported in 2023, 63% were larceny theft, 15% were burglaries and 22% were auto thefts.
The homeless population in California grew from 118,552 in 2013 to 181,399 in 2023. The number of camps in San Francisco reached its highest point since 2020 of 523 sites recorded in September 2023.
Proposition 36 would largely roll back Proposition 47â€™s reforms, upgrading drug possession and theft under $950 to felonies. It would also increase jail time for repeat retail theft, and make the possession of fentanyl a felony.
â€œI fear I canâ€™t do everything. Iâ€™ve got, trying to get Kamala Harris elected President of the United States, trying to get through these 900 bills,â€ Newsom said in a Sept. 19 press conference according to the Bee. â€œI just pray, I really do, that people take a good look at Proposition 36.â€
Newsomâ€™s office did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: From #MeToo To #NotYou: Where Are All The Feminist Celebrities On Emhoff?
content:
None of the female celebrities who have endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris have voiced concerns about her husband, Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff, who allegedly has a history of misconduct against women.
Emhoff admitted in August to cheating on his first wife in 2009 with his daughterâ€™s nanny, whom he allegedly impregnated, according to the Daily Mail. Once back on the dating scene, Emhoff, the â€œDad-in-Chief,â€ allegedly slapped his then-girlfriend in a booze-fueled fit of jealous rage in 2012, three friends familiar with the alleged situation told the outlet.
Celebrities like Ariana Grande, Julia Roberts and Billie Eilish have made no mention of the allegations, yet have expressed their support of Harris. Oprah Winfrey also ignored the alleged situation, but has hosted a pro-Harris town hall alongside Jennifer Lopez and Meryl Streep.
Psaki Says Emhoff Reshaping Perception Of Masculinity
NEW: Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend, days after MSNBC host Jen Psaki said Emhoff was â€œreshaping masculinity.â€
According to the Daily Mail, Emhoff hit a woman so hard that she physically spun around.
New details also reveal thatâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/dBPc8rcBL5
â€” Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) October 2, 2024
Megastar Taylor Swift also endorsed the vice president via Instagram in September, citing abortion rights as one of her top issues. Swift has not used the platform to promote Harris since her original endorsement, nor has she ever acknowledged Emhoffâ€™s alleged behavior.
Other female celebrities, such as Olivia Rodrigo and Jennifer Lawrence, have also pledged their support for Harris, whom they hope will â€œrestore reproductive rights.â€ They too have been silent in the wake of the allegations surfacing.
Some female celebrities, including â€œThe Officeâ€ star Mindy Kaling and Grammy-winning singer Pink, appeared at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) to promote the vice presidentâ€™s campaign in August. Neither of the celebrities have mentioned the allegations against the Second Gentleman. (RELATED: Harris Campaign Holds Rally In Swing State, Invites Pop Star With Ties To Diddy)
Emhoff, who several left-leaning media outlets characterized as a paragon of a new masculinity, was accused of â€œasshole behaviorâ€ and being â€œvery flirtyâ€ at Venable LLP, a law firm he previously managed. Former colleagues of Emhoff who worked there alleged he was also routinely â€œinappropriateâ€ and â€œmisogynisticâ€ during his tenure, the Daily Mail separately reported.
Many of these celebrities offered their labor or intellectual property in service of the Harris campaign â€” BeyoncÃ© granted Harris the rights to her song, â€œFreedom,â€ for campaign advertisements; Anne Hathaway sang at a campaign fundraiser on Broadway; â€œSeinfeldâ€ star Julia Louis Dreyfus promised to be â€œextra involvedâ€ in the Harris campaign â€” but none of them have made any mention of Emhoffâ€™s alleged misdeeds.
Rapper Cardi B, an outspoken critic of President Joe Biden, said Harris should have been the nominee all along. Larger-than-life performer Lizzo joined Harris for a campaign event in Detroit. However, neither of the female musicians appear to have publicly voiced any concerns about the allegations against the Second Gentleman.
Among Harrisâ€™s high-profile supporters are former First Lady Michelle Obama, Jessica Alba, â€œFriendsâ€ star Jennifer Aniston, Jennifer Garner, Glenn Close, â€œScandalâ€ star Kerry Washington, Megan Thee Stallion, pop icon Cher and Barbra Streisand, none of whom have come out against Emhoff.

title: Trump Leading Harris in Key Swing State Two Weeks Before Election Day, Poll Finds
content:
Former President Donald Trump is leading Vice President Kamala Harris in Georgia as election day draws closer, according to a Tuesday poll from the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC).
Trump is leading at 47% while Harris is at 43%, which is outside of the pollâ€™s margin of error of 3.1 percentage points, according to the AJC. Of likely voters that were polled, 8% said that they are still undecided.
Georgia is considered a key battleground state in the 2024 presidential election. The swing state began its first week of voting on Oct. 15 and set an early voting record as 196,000 residents cast their ballots, according to WALB.
There are more than seven million active voters in the state, according to WALB.
A Georgia judge decided on Oct. 15 to block a rule about the state hand-counting ballots on election day amid concerns that it could slow down announcing election results.
While Trump is leading across battleground states, the presidential race is still tight. The Republican candidate has a 1.2 point lead, pulling 48.4% support across seven top battleground states compared to Harris trailing behind at 47.2%, according to polling averages from RealClear Polling.
Harris is ahead of Trump nationwide, with a lead of 0.8 points at 49.3% compared to Trumpâ€™s 48.5%, according to national polling averages from RealClear Polling. (RELATED: Dem Senator Claims Major Swing State Faces â€˜Voter Suppression,â€™ Despite Being Confronted On â€˜High Turnoutâ€™)
Trump has made significant strides among black voters. The Democrats have been attempting to shore up support for Harris from black voters amid concerns of weak enthusiasm from the key voting bloc.
â€œThe most recent polling shows what Team Trump already knew, Georgians from Catoosa to Camden County are tired of the cost-of-living skyrocketing and drugs flowing across the open border into our communities,â€ Morgan Ackley, Georgia Communications Director for the Trump campaign said in a statement shared with the Daily Caller News Foundation. â€œPresident Trump is winning or tied in every battleground, including Georgia, because his message is resonating with voters across the country. This November Georgia will say no to Kamala Harris and yes to Donald Trump and his America First policies.â€

title: Biden Official Says Quiet Part Out Loud: â€˜No One Is Listening To Himâ€™
content:
A Biden official admitted Tuesday to Axios that â€œno one is listeningâ€ to the 81-year-old president after he appeared to claim former President Donald Trump needs to be locked up.
While on a trip to New Hampshire to talk about lowering the cost of prescription drugs, President Joe Biden said â€œwe gotta lock him upâ€ after discussing what he expected Trump to do during a second term. Moments later, the president appeared to clean his comments up by adding, â€œpolitically, lock him up.â€ One of the presidentâ€™s officials responded to the remarks in a statement to Axios, admitting that the president has lost his star power and the comments will soon be forgotten. (RELATED: Biden And Obama Bad-Mouth Harris At Funeral, Pro Lip-Reader Claims)
â€œFor better or worse, no one is listening to him anymore and his words have little power and less reach. Itâ€™s a blip. Gone in any meaningful way by mid-day tomorrow if it makes it that long,â€ a Biden official said, according to Axios national correspondent Alex Thompson.
Biden in NH lists what Trump would do as president and says: â€œwe gotta lock him upâ€ and then, appearing to realize how his comments would be taken, adds: â€œpolitically, lock him up.â€ pic.twitter.com/cw3X8RzKn2
â€” Alex Thompson (@AlexThomp) October 22, 2024
A counterpoint from a current Biden admin official: â€œFor better or worse, no one is listening to him anymore and his words have little power and less reach. Itâ€™s a blip. Gone in any meaningful way by mid-day tomorrow if it makes it that long.â€
â€” Alex Thompson (@AlexThomp) October 22, 2024
A former administration official responded to the comments too in a statement to Thompson, adding that the presidentâ€™s remarks will be hurtful to Vice President Kamala Harris.
â€œWe gotta lock Joe up,â€ the former official said, according to Thompson.
Noting this could be politically unhelpful to Harris, a former Biden admin official texts me: â€œwe gotta lock Joe up.â€ https://t.co/juzeUrhM1H
â€” Alex Thompson (@AlexThomp) October 22, 2024
The presidentâ€™s comments come after the vice presidentâ€™s team seemingly sidelined the 81-year-old from the campaign trail, three Harris campaign officials and three White House officials told NBC News. Biden last appeared on the campaign trail with Harris on Sept. 2 for a joint rally. The vice president has struggled to separate herself from the president and articulate how she would lead differently.
After telling The View he thought he could still beat Trump, the president also dodged the perfect opportunity to defend his vice president after she got in a back and forth with Republican Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis over hurricane recovery efforts.
â€œMr. President, does Gov. DeSantis need to take Vice President Harrisâ€™s calls?â€ RealClearPolitics White House correspondent Phil Wegmann asked.
â€œAll I can tell you is Iâ€™ve talked to Gov. DeSantis. Heâ€™s been very gracious. Heâ€™s thanked me for all weâ€™ve done. He knows what we are doing, and I think thatâ€™s important,â€ the president answered before leaving the room.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Alyssa Farah Encouraged Cassidy Hutchinson To Leak To Reporters Amid Investigation
content:
Former Trump administration official Alyssa Farah Griffin suggested to star Jan. 6 investigation witness Cassidy Hutchinson that she leak to the media while the investigation was ongoing, texts obtained exclusively by the Daily Caller reveal.
Farah, a former Pentagon press secretary during the Trump administration, twice suggested to Hutchinson during active legal proceedings that she should give information to reporters. The pair also discussed ways to circumvent Hutchinsonâ€™s lawyer, Stefan Passantino, to communicate with former Republican Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney and the Jan. 6 committee, as first reported by Just The News.
â€œThe alternative would be to just say fuck it and give it all to a reporter. Lol,â€ Farah texted Hutchinson after the latter asked if Cheney was still interested in working with her.
Shortly thereafter, in texts exclusively obtained by the Caller, Farah suggested that Hutchinson could coordinate with the committee to strategically leak some information to the press after testifying: â€œBtw, another idea.you could sit down and share it with the committee but then have the committee shares the big stuff you give them with press before your transcripts come out so it looks like it came from someone else.â€
In later discussions, Hutchinson mentions that she is concerned with how to â€œreconfigureâ€ her â€œreputationâ€ within the media.
Passantino told the Caller he had no suspicions about such activity at the time and confirmed that he had never seen these specific messages between Hutchinson and Farah. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: House Republicans Call Out Cassidy Hutchinsonâ€™s J6 Testimony, Threaten Subpoena If She Does Not Produce Documents)
â€œThis is the first I am seeing of some of these texts, but everything here is consistent with what I have been saying publicly and alleging in the various lawsuits I have filed over the past 18 months. I am surprised and pleased to see the facts coming to light,â€ Passantino told the Caller. (RELATED: iPhone Screenshot Undermines Cassidy Hutchisonâ€™s Claim That She Never Dated Matt Gaetz)
Hutchinson began the conversation by asking about a previous discussion the two apparently had, and if Farah had â€œtouched baseâ€ with anyone about it.
â€œHey! Yes. So I reached out to Liz. She agreed to keep our convo totally confidential. She said she admires you, and could tell that you wanted to the right thing from your testimony. Her one concern was so long ad you have counsel, she canâ€™t really ethically talk to you without him. But what she suggests is a follow up with you, with your lawyer thats he and Dan George can lead. Probably can do without other members and Tim Does that help at all? I can tell she really wants to work with you and is just tryin to figure out the right way to do it,â€ Farah responded.
â€œI mean, do you think this is actually of interest to her at this point or is it moot Like have they moved beyond it,â€ Hutchinson replied.
â€œOh itâ€™s very much of interest. She basically just wants to structure it in a way you are comfortable and wants to make sure itâ€™s clear, if you speak to them again, itâ€™s them asking, not you, so you donâ€™t get in trouble with trump world,â€ Farah said. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: House Republicans Demand Comms Between Cassidy Hutchinson, Fani Willisâ€™ Office For J6 Investigation)
Hutchinson then described having trouble getting in touch with her attorney, before they discuss the prospect of leaking information to a reporter.
â€œMy patience is razor thin,â€ Hutchinson said.
â€œDo you think your lawyer would drop you? I feel like you could represent yourself,â€ Farah asked.
â€œI never signed anything I asked several and he said it wasnâ€™t necessary,that they had it taken care of So from a legal pov Iâ€™m not sure? But Iâ€™d assume??â€ Hutchinson responded.
â€œI just looked. I texted him Sunday morning to talk, he said heâ€™d call that afternoon or Monday morning. Thatâ€™s the last I heard from him despite following up every day since,â€ Hutchinson continued. â€œAm I overthinking this??â€
â€œIâ€™m sorry Iâ€™m not trying to be a nuisance,â€ she added.
Farah said she wanted Hutchinson to â€œbe freeâ€ of the situation and proposed that she could potentially get immunity before sharing information with Cheney and the committee.
Hutchinson then asked if she may be asked to testify live.
â€œShe was very clear theyâ€™d want to talk to you behind closed doors at least one more time before theyâ€™d put you up publicly,â€ Farah replied.
Hutchinson then asked if the committee would ask her to come back for more questioning, and claimed that Passantino would tell her to â€œgo F myselfâ€ if she volunteered to do so.
â€œOk thatâ€™s a good question. She was thinking sheâ€™d just ask you back for additional questions. But you probably donâ€™t want them to go through Stefan? She is open to doing this anyway thatâ€™s like ethical/ legal,â€ Farah responded.
Farah went on to propose that her own lawyer may be willing to take on Hutchinsonâ€™s representation pro bono.
Days later, Hutchinson asked Farah to call her â€œasapâ€ after she spoke to Passantino.
â€œdg called him Friday and asked about me coming in. Stephan gave me the weekend â€˜to think on itâ€™ He just said we will comply but heâ€™s going to push back,â€ Hutchinson told Farah. â€œdgâ€ seemingly refers to Dan George, a lawyer for the committee.
â€œHmm ok. That was definitely at Lizâ€™s direction. How do you feel about just doing it with Stefan but answering more questions? You can handle yourself and heâ€™s just there as a figurehead,â€ Farah responded.
â€œAnd basically give ultimatum of a) weâ€™ll come back but we need assurance she wonâ€™t be called in live (which I donâ€™t think theyâ€™ll give) OR b) if you wonâ€™t give us an assurance, re-issue a subpoena,â€ Hutchinson said.
â€œHeâ€™s not against me complying. Heâ€™s actually sort of willing to do it be he thinks it builds my credibility as a witness. But he wants just enough from the committee to balance out the public backlash from the lawsuit and to frame me as super compliant/respectful of congressional subpoenas,â€ she continued.
â€œHeâ€™s going to call dan George this afternoon. Can you tip off Liz or Dan? And see their thoughts?,â€ Hutchinson asked Farah.
â€œIâ€™m personally fine w just Liz and dan but I have a feeling heâ€™ll want it structurally the same as my other Depos. But I havenâ€™t gotten that far w him,â€ Hutchinson said.
â€œDoes that make sense,â€ she asked.
â€œYeah that all makes sense. I actually agree with Stefanâ€™s approach and think itâ€™s accomplished everyoneâ€™s goals. I am happy to tip liz off. And for what itâ€™s worth I donâ€™t think you are close to front in line to testify live But it might be worth asking for the commitment,â€ Farah responded.
â€œMy guess is Stefan cares about protecting trump. Youâ€™re issues were more with meadows and folks around him. And you were simply being honest,â€ she added.
â€œExactly. He doesnâ€™t want me to stonewall the committee now, over this. I think he wants to balance the perception in Trump world if I just go back voluntarily vs. under subpoena,â€ Hutchinson said.
â€œBut heâ€™s probably going to be a bit less friendly to DG when he talks to him. He prob wonâ€™t outright tell him to re-subpoena me, so it may be helpful for DG to throw in (if theyâ€™d do that) â€˜well if you donâ€™t voluntarily come in, weâ€™re likely reissue a subpoenaâ€™,â€ she added.
Hutchinson said their agreed-upon approach could help to â€œreconfigureâ€ her â€œreputationâ€ in the press. She then asked Farah to pass information to Cheney that her and her former lawyer do not plan to fight a subpoena, but that Passantino wants the committee to think they will.
â€œHe talked to DG. Convo was consistent w/ what we discussed. SP told him weâ€™ll need a subpoena to comply, but will â€˜need to decide whether weâ€™re going to fight it.â€™ (Weâ€™re def not going to fight it, but he wants the committee to think we will). Ir case you want to pass to LC or DG,â€ Hutchinson said.
Weeks later, Hutchinson texted Farah she felt like she could â€œdrink myself into a coma.â€
â€œLike I could drink myself into a coma,â€ Hutchinson responded. Farah said she thought the committee would make her testify live.
â€œReally?,â€ Hutchinson asked.
Hutchinson made headlines after testifying before the Jan. 6 committee. She claimed former President Donald Trump lunged for the steering wheel to reroute his car to the Capitol where protesters were gathering on Jan. 6. Sources close to the Secret Service have denied her claims. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Cassidy Hutchinson Begged Senior Trump Officials For â€˜Financial Assistanceâ€™ After Being Subpoenaed By J6 Committee)
Hutchinson called the Jan. 6 committee â€œbsâ€ in a text message obtained exclusively by the Caller and also begged former senior Trump officials for financial assistance and legal help in February 2022 after she was subpoenaed by the committee. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Text Messages Show Cassidy Hutchinson Referring To January 6 Committee As â€˜BSâ€™)
Hutchinson did not respond to a request for comment.
Editorâ€™s Note: This article was updated to clarify which texts were obtained exclusively by the Daily Caller.
